loans.name: Africano

texts.en: Africano is a fifty-two-year-old man who is married with four children. He operates a retail shop business in which he sells domestic items like sugar, salt, toilet paper and cooking oil. He has been in the retailing business for three years. He says that even though it is still small, it has had a positive growth trend since he started it. His hardship is customers not paying on time. His personal goal is educating his children, and his business goal is expanding his business to new markets. He needs the loan facility to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Abeteraine Bughoye Group

texts.en: Kalen is a sixty-year-old man, married with sixteen children, who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is a member of the Abeteraine Bughoye group in which members co-guarantee each other for access to credit. He has been dealing in agriculture businesses, doing both farming and selling beans, maize, ground nuts and bananas for four years. His hardships are price fluctuations, bad seasons and high transport costs. His vision is to have a well established food stuff shop, plus educating his children to university level. Kalen needs the loan facility to enable him buy bananas, beans and maize flour for selling.

loans.use: To buy bananas, beans and maize flour for selling.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a thirty-eight-year-old man, married, and the father to four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in farming and photography businesses for six years. His hardship is the lack of enough capital to expand the farmland, and his vision is to see his businesses gain growth momentum and also to build a permanent house for his family.

Asaph needs the loan facility to enable him to buy beans seeds for planting and also to pay for farm labor.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds for planting and also to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi is a 27-year-old married man from Gaza who lives with his wife and daughter.  In 2009, Shadi decided that he would like to have his own farm on which he raises sheep. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy more sheep for his farm.  He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new wood-cutting machine.

loans.name: Sa'ed

texts.en: Sa'ed is a young man who is 31 years old. He is a university student in addition to his work on a cattle farm with a decent salary. Sa'ed wants to pay his university fees so he can complete the course and get his first university degree, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN. When Sa'ed gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay his university fees and complete his course. When he gets his first university degree successfully, it will change his life positively and let him live in better conditions. Sa'ed is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Athab

texts.en:
Athab  is a 31-year-old single woman from Madaba, Jordan. Athab has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase foodstuffs for her store.

Athab started her business some years ago, selling a small variety of products, but with her hard work she has been able to improve her store and widen her product range.

Athab is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their living income.

Due to culturA. issues, Athab preferred not to share her photo on the internet, so the woman in the photo is Athab's Mother.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for the store.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 19-year-old single woman from Madab, Jordan. She has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more products for the store.

Majd is looking to improving her store and widen the variety of products she sells.

Due to culturA. issues, her father is photographed here.

loans.use: to purchase more products for the store.

loans.name: Nofah

texts.en:
Nofah is 48 years old and a married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of 6 children. She sells accessories and home products. She started the business by selling only tea cups then she expanded into many other necessary home products in addition to accessories.

Nofah is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase more products to sell so that she increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones for his store.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 41-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and she is a mother of six children. She makes pastries from home and she is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase a new oven which will help her increase her quantities.

Eman started her business by making pastries only for her neighbours and the nearby schools; then she start receiving orders from other areas.

Eman is looking to increase her business volume and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven for her business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина снова хотела бы пополнить ассортимент женской одежды для продажи в этом осенне-зимнем сезоне. Она планирует использовать кредит в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить дополнительно количество кофт, свитеров, курток и юбок, что и побудило ее обратиться за очередным кредитом КИВА.
Прибыль, полученную от вложения в свой бизнес прошлого кредита, Валентина потратила на содержание семьи и реинвестирование в свое дело.
Валентина хорошо ведет бизнес, вовремя делает вложения, добродушная, серьезно относится к обязательствам.
Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Valentina is seeking to once again increase her selection of women's clothing for retail, for the fall-winter season. She plans to use the loan of 8,000 UAH to purchase additional stock of blouses, sweaters, jackets and skirts. This is the reason she is applying for another loan with KIVA. The profit that Valentina made after investing her previous loan into the business, was used for family expenses and reinvested into her business. Valentina runs her business well and makes payments on time. She is kind, and takes her responsibilities seriously.

loans.use: purchase blouses, sweaters, jackets and skirts

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en: Nabeel,  21 years old, has a vehicle repair workshop by which he earns a living. He wants to improve the quality of his work and so is requesting a loan of $3,000 from FATEN to purchase a new vehicle repair kit. The loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, will enable Nabeel to increase his income and improve his living conditions. He is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle repair kit.

loans.name: Dennis Anold

texts.en:
Dennis is a thirty-three-year-old hardworking man who is married with one child and two dependents, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to build a self sustainable and economically sound household to meet the developing and challenging economy. 

He has been growing bananas and eucalyptus trees for the last four years and has been challenged by poor soils and increasingly expensive labor. In spite of this, he has managed to sell his products and plant more trees. His dream is to have 100 acres of land covered with eucalyptus trees. Dennis needs the loan to buy fertilizers for his banana and tree plantations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his banana and tree plantations.

loans.name: Willington

texts.en: Willington is a Ugandan male, aged 50 years, who needs a loan to buy sodas for resale. This retail shop owner hails from the Kyenjojo district and is the father of four children between the ages of 24 and 8. Having had this business for 10 years, he dreams of growing into a wholesale business and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy sodas for resale.

loans.name: Volodya

texts.ru:
С помощью кредита от КИВА Володя в прошлом году смог построить несколько небольших теплиц, его прибыль составила 100 000 гривен (до этого было 80 000 гривен). Володе очень помог кредит от КИВА, поэтому он обратился за финансовой помощью сюда вновь. В этот раз Володя берет кредит на постройку арочной теплицы, так как те, которые у него есть на данный момент - из дуг и они не очень надежные.    
За это время второй сын пришел из армии, устроился на работу, помогает семье. У Володи большая семья, шестеро детей и финансовая стабильность для них крайне важна.
texts.en: With the help of a loan from KIVA last year, Volodia built several medium-size greenhouses. His profit was 100,000 UAH (previously, it was 80,000 UAH). The loan helped Volodya significantly, and so he is once again turning to KIVA for financial help. This time, Volodya is applying for a loan to construct arched greenhouses, because his current greenhouses are not very stable. Since his first loan, his second son has returned from the army, has found a job, and is helping the family. Volodya has a large family - six children - and financial stability is very important for them.

loans.use: to build arched greenhouses

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 60-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and she has 6 children. She sells milk and makes milk products from her home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase milk and materials needed to make dairy products.

Maha is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more milk.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 25-year-old married woman from Madab, Jordan and the mother of one child. She has a grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more foodstuffs for her store.

Mai is looking to expand her business and improve her family's  living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 36 years old and a married father of 4 children, aged 7-16, living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a hardworking man and very responsible. His family goal is to educate his children. He is a taxi driver and has been running this business for 10 years. He now wants to venture into a motorcycle business and has already bought one. His dream is to own at least five motorcycles. Ali needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Yulia

texts.ru:
Юлия решила снова воспользоваться кредитом КИВА, потому что благодаря последнему кредиту она смогла расширить ассортимент товара, увеличить свой доход, получила дополнительную прибыль, сделала привлекательной свою торговую точку. В этот раз она решила вложить кредит в 20 000 гривен в закупку теплой модной молодежной женской одежды.  
Юлия раньше работала, используя свидетельство регистрации частного предпринимателя своего мужа. Но после декрета она смогла оформить свои предпринимательские документы и раскрутила бизнес еще больше. Ей нравится быть независимой и самостоятельной и вкладывать силы и время в свое дело. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Yulia decided to once again apply for a loan from Kiva, because thanks to her last loan she was able to expand her selection of goods, increase income and profits, and made her retail location more attractive. This time, she has decided to invest her loan of 20,000 UAH into expanding her inventory of fashionable warm clothing for young women. Yulia previously worked under her husband's business license, but after her maternal leave, she has received her own registration and has been able to grow her business. She enjoys being independent and investing her time and energy into her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of trendy warm clothing for women

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 42 years old and married with 4 children, living in a rented house with 6 people in Hoima, Uganda. He has been running a business of spare parts for 10 years.

He started by working as a mechanic and later started his own spare parts shop. He faces a challenge of electricity being unstable, and hopes in the future to have a hardware shop. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Mana'

texts.en:
Mana' is a young man who is 24 years old and lives at the borders of the capital, Sana'a. He is still single and living with his parent. He is a university student studying at the Faculty of Education, Sana'a University.

Mana' bought his taxi two years ago with the support of his father so that the young man could start his life and cover his own personal and educational expenses as well as save for marriage. Mana' faced a challenge of whether to be free for his taxi or to study but eventually could do both. He is free to do the taxi business after university hours.

Mana' faced a financial challenge as the income of his taxi is used to support his study when his taxi broke down and he became unable to cover the cost of maintenance. Then he took a loan of 100,000 Rials from AMB to repair his taxi. The taxi has been broken down for a couple of months. 

Mana' hopes to save money in order to replace the current taxi that is usually broken down due to mechanical problems, with a new taxi. He is also planning to save for marriage.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга снова обратилась за кредитом КИВА, потому что ей очень нравятся эти выгодные и удобные условия кредитования. Она попробовала один раз и осталась очень довольна. В этот раз она планирует использовать кредит в 20 000 гривен для  того, чтобы закупить семена помидор и огурцов для продажи фермерам-тепличникам в своем регионе. Получив прибыль благодаря предыдущему кредиту, Ольга смогла приобрести грузовой микроавтобус для перевозки товара. Более того, в этом году она смогла позволить себе отдохнуть с семьей осенью в Славском, Карпатах. Скоро дочь Ольги собирается замуж, семья Ольги уже планирует эту свадьбу и готовится к ней.

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Olga is again applying for Kiva credit, because she really likes the convenience and favorable conditions of the loan. She has borrowed before and was very satisfied with the experience. This time, she plans to use the loan of 20,000 UAH to buy wholesale tomato and cucumber seeds, to sell to greenhouse farmers in her region. Having made a profit thanks to her previous loan, Olga purchased a mini-bus for transporting goods. Additionally, this fall she was able to take a vacation with her family in the town of Slavskoie, in the Carpathian Mountains. Soon her daughter will get married, and Olga's family is already planning the wedding and making the necessary preparations.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale tomato and cucumber seeds for sale to local greenhouse farmers

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья решила воспользоваться кредитом КИВА, потому что ее очень устраивает возможность взять кредит на короткий срок, ей это удобно. Предыдущий кредит КИВА Наталья вложила в закупку керамической посуды и горшков, в летний период открыла выносную торговлю. 
Наталья совсем недавно смогла позволить себе нанять няню для младшего ребенка, что раньше было ей не по карману. 
Кредит в 20 000 гривен Наталья хотела бы вложить в оптовую закупку привозного китайского товара (иголки, нитки, швейные принадлежности). 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya decided use a Kiva loan because she really likes the ability to obtain a loan for short period of time, which is convenient for her.  Natalya used her previous Kiva loan to purchase ceramic dishware and pots and opened remote sales during the summer period.  Recently, Natalya was able to hire a nanny for her youngest child, which is something she could not afford to do before.  Natalya is requesting a loan in the sum of 20 000 hryvnia to invest into a wholesale purchase of imported Chinese merchandise (needles, threads and sewing accessories).

loans.use: to purchase new imported Chinese merchandise (needles, threads, sewing accessories)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр использовал предыдущий кредит для закупки пленки, семян и удобрений. 
Теперь он хочет использовать кредит КИВА в 8 000 гривен на развитие сельского хозяйства. Он вложит полученные средства в устройство отопления в теплицы: нужно закупить трубы и уголь. 
За счет прибыли, полученной от использования предыдущего кредита Александр и его семья смогли приобрести большой холодильник для хранения птицы и мяса, а также купили новый телевизор для семьи. 
Александр кроме огорода занимается выращиванием кур-бройлеров и свиней. Каждые три месяца он берет 100 кур, выращивает и продает на рынке. За счет этого, в основном, вся семья и живет зимой.

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Alexander used his previous loan for the purchase of plastic, seeds and fertilizers.  He now wants to use a Kiva loan in the sum of 8 000 hryvnia to develop his agricultural business.  He will invest the received funds into installing heating in his greenhouses, for which he will need to buy pipes and coal.  Thanks to the profit received from using the previous loan, Alexander and his family were able to purchase a big refrigerator used to store poultry and meat, and also bought a new television for the family.  Besides farming, Alexander is involved in raising broilers and pigs.  He acquires 100 chickens every three months, raises and sells them at a market.  Thanks to this business, the entire family lives well in the winter.

loans.use: to buy pipes and coal in order to install heating for greenhouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tawfig

texts.en:
Tawfig is a young man who is 26 years He is living in Sana'a and was recently married. He is a university student, studying in the  Accounting Department, the Faculty of Commerce and Economy,  Sana'a University. 

Tawfig's main business is a stationary and mobile accessories store based in the southern part of Sana'a. He started his business a year ago in a very intelligent way. That is, as he owns a house, he has a tenant with the same activity (stationary) who paid him the rent of some months in stationary materials. Tawfig collected those materials and purchased some more mobile accessories and started his independent business. Now, Tawfig has many clients and his income improved.  When he is at university, he places his younger brother in the business.

Tawfig wanted to expand his business but he didn't have the financial capacity. He took this first loan from AMB and repaid it successfully. Then he took this loan, which is the second loan amounting to 100,000 Rials in order to purchase stationary supplies and phone accessories to meet his clients' demands.

In the future, Tawfig hopes to expand his business by opening a supermarket as well as to establish an independent business for his younger brother.

loans.use: to purchase stationary supplies and phone accessories

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and deals in a transport business. He started as an employee of Pepsi cola and now he owns a truck and also has a poultry project. He faces the problem of rising fuel prices, and he dreams of buying another truck so as to increase his income. Charles wants a loan to buy tires for the truck and pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy tires for the truck and pay school fees.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 36-year-old lady, who has one son and one daughter. Rania has a full-time job working as an employee in one of the banks here in Jordan. After getting off work, she usually goes help her husband at their store in Madaba.

Rania’s husband runs a candle shop, where they sell scented candles in different sizes, for all occasions. They have been running this shop for almost a year. 

Now Rania has applied for a loan to redecorate their candle shop and buy more items such as candles holders.

loans.use: to redecorate their candle shop and buy more items such as candle holders.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela wants a loan to renovate her rentals. She lives in Masindi, Uganda, and is a widow with three children. She started with a house and now has two. Her dream is to own an estate. Her major challenge is tenants who are negligent with the property.

loans.use: to renovate her rentals.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice wants a loan to buy general merchandise for resale. She lives in Masindi, Uganda, and is a single mother charged with the responsibility of taking care of her three children. She started a retail business one year ago. However, she is challenged with fluctuating prices, and she hopes to open up a wholesale shop. Beatrice needs the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 25-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has 3 children, aged 8, 6 and 1.

She is a farmer and has been growing rice for 8 years. She sells her harvest at her town’s market. Each month, she earns about 5,000 PHP doing this farming. Angelita plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor of those she hired to help till her land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is a 39-year-old married mother of  three sons and three daughters; her husband and one of her daughters are workers with decent salaries. Ilham, who sells gas canisters to earn income, wants to improve her business and income by purchasing more canisters for sale. She is therefore requesting a loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, of $2,000 from FATEN, to make the purchase. The additional resulting income will enable Ilham to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more gas canisters for sale.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson, a hardworking 25-year-old, lives in Kasese, Uganda where he has been operating a boutique and retail shop for five years. Edson started with capital of 2,000,000 shillings saved from a previous saloon business and now has 10,000,000 shillings.

Facing the business hardships of price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital, Edson is requesting this loan to buy shoes, clothes and soap for resale. His personal goal is self-education, and his business goal is the operation of a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and soap to sell.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en:
Yazan is a 24-year-old artist who inherited the talent from his parents; most of the family members are artists.

Yazan, who paints wonderful paintings, participates in some of the locA. art exhibitions; the latest exhibition was conducted at the University of Jordan where he sold a few paintings.

Now Yazan has applied for a loan to buy new painting tools to enhance his portraits and have more paintings so he can participate in larger exhibitions in the future, both in and outside Jordan.

loans.use: To buy new painting tools to enhance his portraits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 41 years old. She is a married woman with three children between ages 2 and 17. Benedicta’s husband is a farmer.

Benedicta has had a sari-sari store business for four years. She sells items like oil, vinegar, soft drinks and shampoo. Benedicta also sells dried fish to the people in her community. She earns about 3000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as soap, soft drinks, oil and dried fish. Benedicta hopes that her store will grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soap, soft drinks, oil and dried fish.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He has been in the electronics business for eight years. He started with 3 million shillings and now has 5 million shillings. His hardship is customers not paying on time, building a permanent house and expanding to new markets. Julius needs a loan to buy solar panels to sell.

loans.use: to buy solar panels to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for 17 years. She started with capital of 400,000 shillings and now has 4 million shillings. Her hardship is lack of capital, and her vision is having her own stock, building a better house and educating her children. Joyce needs the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 49 years old and is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 6. Her husband works as a land surveyor.

Lucila has had a sari-sari store business for 15 years. She sells various items like chips, noodles, soap and shampoo. She earns about 5000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan and plans to purchase more items to sell such as rice and canned goods. Lucila plans to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a 27-year -old married woman with three children who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been milling cassava for five years. She started with capital of 500,000 UGX from the sale of cotton and now has 3,000,000 UGX. 

Her hardships are debtors and bad weather conditions. Her vision is to have capital of 10,000,000 UGX plus to educate her children.

Rachael needs the loan to buy cassava to resell.

loans.use: to buy cassava.

loans.name: Bart

texts.en:
Bart is a 37-year-old divorced man with five children. 

He has been in the retail shop business for six months after diverting from the carpentry business. 

His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock, and his goals are educating children and building a permanent house.

Bart needs the loan to buy bread, eggs and detergent for sale.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs and detergent.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 28-year-old married man with two children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for two years. He started with three million UGX and now has four million.

His hardships are insufficient capital and high transport costs, and his vision is a big retail shop plus educating his children.

Moses needs a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Levi

texts.en:
Maria Levi is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family. 

Maria Levi sells “balut” (a boiled, fertilized egg) for a living. Maria Levi has been in this business for four years. She plans to use her loan to buy vinegar and more balut to sell. Maria Levi hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vinegar and more balut to sell.

loans.name: Hamidu

texts.en:
Hamidu is a 39-year-old married man with four children who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in the salon and retail shop business for two years. He started with 200,000 UGX and now he has 2,500,000 UGX. 

His hardship is limited capital and his vision is business expansion plus building another house.

Hamidu needs the loan to buy hair dryers.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 28 years old and married. She has a 2-year-old child. Marisol’s husband works as a Barangay official.

Marisol has had a sari-sari store business for two years. She sells items like canned goods, sugar, vinegar and soy sauce. Marisol earns 3,000 PHP per month with her business. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and noodles. Marisol hopes to earn better and be able to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cups and glasses for sell.

loans.name: Clarence

texts.en:
Clarence is a 30-year-old married man with one child.

He has been in the secretarial and Internet business for three years. 

His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are to build a permanent house and to improve his stock to maximize profits.

Clarence needs the loan to buy a photocopier and stationery.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and stationery.

loans.name: Pania

texts.en:
Pania is 61 years old, married, and has nine adult children. Her younger children still go to school. Pania’s husband is a farmer.

Pania has been running a sari-sari (variety) store business for two years. She sells items like shampoo, coffee and bread. Each month, Pania earns 3,000 PHP with her business. 

She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap and shampoo. Pania hopes for her living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Silvera

texts.en:
Silvera is a 33-year-old married woman with six children age between 8 and 13. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Silvera has been running a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells canned goods, shampoo, soap and other items. She also helps her husband sell rice. 

Silvera has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as noodles and canned goods. Silvera hopes for her store to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Godofreda

texts.en:
Godafreda is 59 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her husband works as a seaweed farmer.

Godafreda has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for nine years. She sells soft drinks, shampoo, coffee and other items. Godafreda also sells coconut wine to the people in her community. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as coconut wine, soft drinks, shampoo and soap. 

Godafreda hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as coconut wine, soft drinks, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en:
Jinna is a 44-year-old widow with three children. The oldest child is 22 years old.

Jinna makes peanut rolls that she sells to sari-sari (variety) store owners in her town. She has been in this business for four years. Each month, Jinna earns 7000 PHP with her business. She requested a loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, wrappers, sugar and oil. Jinna hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as peanuts, wrappers, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize and rice for sale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 19 years old.

Marissa is engaged in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him in their fishing business. Marissa sells all his catch at the market where she rents a stall. She requested this loan to purchase a boat engine and fishing nets. Marissa hopes to be able to sustain her children’s education through their business.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en: Nilo is a married man with 10 children. He is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. Nilo and his wife sell his catch at the market. Aside from fish, Nilo also sells seaweed. Nilo requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and more seaweed to sell. Nilo hopes to have a successful business in the future. He also hopes for his children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and more seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a hardworking married man aged 43 and he is a fish monger. He started by buying oranges and reselling them. He wants to finish the construction of his house and educate his children. 

Jimmy wants a loan to buy a motorcycle to help him in transporting fish to the market.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport fish for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 71 years old and married with seven adult children. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 20 years. Francisca sells sugar, vinegar, canned goods and other various products. She earns about 8000 PHP per month with her business.

Francisca has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo and also rice. Francisca hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo and also rice.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 45 years old and is a food vendor. She makes rice cakes, "banana cue" (fried and sold on a stick) and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. Magdalena also grows vegetables to sell.

Magdalena has requested a loan to purchase ingredients such as oil, bananas, sugar and rice. Magdalena hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as oil, bananas, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Salem De Ouanaminthe 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Micheline est la coordonatrice de son groupe SALEM DE OUANAMINTHE.

Elle est  mariée elle a des enfants. Micheline habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Micheline a dirigé son business pendant les 10 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des vetements

Micheline espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Les autres membres Salem ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses.
texts.en:
Micheline is the coordinator of SALEM DE OUANAMINTHE Group. She's married and has children. She lives in OUANAMINTHE in Haiti, where electricity is very limited and water very constrained.

Micheline has been running her business for ten years. She would like to use this loan to purchase clothing. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business.

The other members of the group need a loan for their businesses, such as : selling charcoal, rice, and secondhand clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is 46 years old and lives in Chkalovka village, Sevan area. She is married and lives with her mother and three sons. Alina’s husband temporary lives and works in Russia and helps his family in Armenia. Alina’s eldest son is in Armenian army; the two others are pupils. 

Alina hasn’t any profession, but she has been engaged in farming and cattle breeding for long time. Despite the fact that Alina is an invalid and has health problems, she can’t stay at home and as she said, she engages in animal breeding with great pleasure .Alina keeps cows, sheep and horses. She has her own plot of land on which she harvessts fodder for her animals. Alina’s mother and sons helps her in animal breeding. Meat and milk from cattle breeding are sold in the Sevan area. 

Alina needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to add to the number of sheep she raises, which will help her to increase the profit from her animal-breeding business.

loans.use: To add to the number of sheep she raises.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casado y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El va comprar terneros para su engorde y la venta posteriormente. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación racional de este proyecto. Además el quiere implementar su proyecto de engorde de ganado y generar el máximo de ganancias. El quiere obtener del proyecto  el máximo de ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida cada día y a la vez mejorar su estabilidad económica en el futuro  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marvin is 50 years old. He is married and lives with his 3 children and wife and they are his biggest priority. He buys calves to fatten up and later sell. He has enough land to do this project. He also wants to expand his cattle raising project and generate maximum profit. He wants to give his family the nest quality of life and at the same time improve his financial stability for the future. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans before from government banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with ease of payment and much lower interest.

loans.use: to buy calves

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Carmelino

texts.es: Carmelino, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar lechones para su desarrollo y se su engorde posterior. El cuenta con los locales donde desarrollara la actividad de buena manera. El quiere implementar su proyecto de nuevo y poder desarrollar sus cerdos de buena manera para su posterior venta y complacencia a su clientes con la calidad vendida. El quiere generar o tiene como su meta prioritaria aumentar las ganancias de la venta de sus cerdos y así a su vez ayudarles a sus padres con las responsabilidades del hogar. El espera poder cambiar su nivel económico de vida y su bienestar familiar para un futuro de mayor prosperidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carmelino is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings at this time. With the loan he is going to buy piglets to later develop and fatten up. He has the space to do the activity well. He is going to do the project again and develop his pigs well so that he can sell them later and please his customers with their quality. He wants to generate income and his main priority is increasing his earnings by selling pigs so he can help his parents with the household expenses. He hopes to change his financial situation and his family's wellbeing for a more prosperous future. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans before from government banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with ease of payment and much lower interests.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten up.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 58 years old and a widow. She is left with four children, with the oldest being 28 years old.

Epifania runs a fishing business. She hires an operator for her fishing boat. Epifania has been running her business for 15 years. She works hard to support her children. She decided to put up a sari-sari (variety) store business to augment her income.

Epifania has requested a loan to buy fishing nets and more items to sell at her store. Epifania hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 46 years old and is a married man with five children. He runs a vulcanizing shop in Trinidad, Bohol. Ernesto hired a few workers to help him run his shop. Ernesto also ventured into seaweed farming. He works hard to support his family and keep his children in school.

Ernesto requested this loan to buy wooden pegs and straw for seaweed farming and materials for his vulcanizing shop. Ernesto plans to use his profit to pay his workers.

loans.use: to buy wooden pegs and straw for seaweed farming and materials for his vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is 44 years old and married. He has a 17-year-old child. Florencio is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Florencio also engaged in fishing to augment his income.

Florencio requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets. Florencio is hoping to improve his family’s living conditions through his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a 58-year-old married woman with eight children. Her children are aged between 14 and 26. Herminia’s husband is a fisherman.

Herminia is engaged in seaweed farming. She also helps her husband sell his catch at the market. Herminia works hard to help support her family. She requested a loan to purchase materials for seaweed farming such as wooden pegs and straw.

loans.use: to purchase materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Ranulfo

texts.en:
Ranulfo is 44 years old and married. He has two children aged 23 and 24. Ranulfo has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. He sells items like sugar, soft drinks and canned goods. Ranulfo earns about 4500 PHP per month with his business. 

He plans to use his loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice. Ranulfo hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old, married with three children, resides at Bagakay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gemma owns a sari-sari store and sells goods in order to earn money for their daily needs. Every month, Gemma earns 5,000 PHP and she's been in this business for three years. Gemma requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase goods for her sari-sari store. She's been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.

Gemma's future plan is to widen her sari-sari store's inventory and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Jane Amor

texts.en:
Jane is from Catadman Ozamiz City.Jane is 52 years old, married, and has three children. Jane has owned and operated a motorcycle transportation business for five years. Jane earns 10,000 PHP per month in this business. Jane requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. 

Jane has been a member of GDMPC for two years. Jane's future plan is to expand her motorcycle transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya, 60 years old and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow with four children, all of whom are married and have families of their own. Despite her senior age, Ligaya still wants to continue doing business as it keeps her busy and is a good use of her time. 

Ligaya sells RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes. She buys a variety of clothes, displays them in her store, and sometimes sells directly to her clients. She buys clothes of different designs and sizes at wholesale and then sells them at retail prices that allow her to earn a better profit. She also sells processed foods like hotdogs, bacon, and chicken as an additional source of income. She earns 800 PHP in daily sales.

She is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP that will help her to have additional capital. She will utilize the loan to buy a variety of ready-to-wear clothes and processed meats. The Christmas season is coming, and the demand for clothes and processed meat is high during this season. She wants to be ready for the orders that are about to come.  

Ligaya wants to improve her business and be more successful. She wants to extend help to her grandchildren who are now studying. Ligaya hopes that all of them will finish their studies. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to believe more in God’s love for mankind. The Bible sharing allows her to learn more about the life of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of clothes and processed meats

loans.name: Lendi

texts.en:
Lendi is a widower with two children. His children are seven and six years old. He has rented out retail space for the past year to supplement his income as a driver. This is his first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and he will use it for renovations to his rental spaces. He also will use some of it to pay school fees for his two children. His business is going well so far but there is other competition for retail space. Therefore his space needs repairs in order for him to keep renting it. 

He hopes that by having income from the rental business and being a driver, he can create a better life for his children.

loans.use: to pay for renovations for the retail spaces that he rents to shopkeepers

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina works hard to support her family. Rosina is married and has a business selling coconuts in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Rosina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy coconuts to sell.

In the future, Rosina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Diamond Grace Group

texts.en:
Iyus is 39 years old and married with one child. His child is two years old but lives in the village away from Jakarta with his extended family. 

Iyus and his wife have been producing and selling krupuk (Indonesian chips) for five years. His favorite part of the business is that he gets to work with his wife. The business has been going well and enables him to send money to the village where his child lives. 

He now wants to expand the business and open another kiosk to sell krupuk out of. His long-term goal for his business is to someday have his own krupuk factory. He hopes that with the income from his expanded business he and his wife can eventually save enough money to live together with their child. 

Some of the other members of the group will use their loans to buy and resell electronics on credit and for their rice and food stalls.

loans.use: to pay for more ingrediants and have enough capital to open another kiosk to sell krupuk (Indonesian chips)

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda, 36, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

Gilda is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Gilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Gilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liza is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Liza has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Liza requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Abbasy Grace Group

texts.en: Dahlia is 25 years old, married, and has one child who is three years old. She has been repairing air conditioners for the past three years. The business is doing well but the problem is she doesn't have enough tools to repair all types of air conditioners. Currently, she has been working out of her house but someday hopes she can open her own service kiosk. She enjoys her business because it allows her to meet many people. Her husband is factory worker so her income supplements what he makes. They hope that they can send their child to school through college.

loans.use: to buy more tools to repair air conditioners

loans.name: Hiper Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Wenny is married and has four children. The three of her children who are of school-going age are currently attending school. 

Wenny is 37 years old and has been cooking and selling snacks for the last six years. Her business has been growing and the orders have increased, so she needs this loan to buy more ingredients to expand the snacks she sells. Cooking has always been her hobby, so she is happy she was able to turn it into a profitable business. The main challenge she faces with her business is planning how much to cook each day because the snacks spoil after one day. 

Her hope for her business is that she can eventually open a shop inside the mall. Her hope for her family is one day they can have their own home from the savings. Other group members have businesses selling clothes on credit and selling cellphone minute refills.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to make new varieties of snacks

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 51, is married and has six children, two of whom are in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business, raising chicken in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her chickens.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, 57, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years.

Norma requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and widowed. She has five children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn has been in this business for eight years now.

Marilyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda is 62 years old and a widow with six children.

Gerarda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dressmaking supplies shop in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Gerarda has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dressmaking supplies shop for 12 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and ready-to-wear sales.

Gerarda aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Heart

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Heart works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dealing beauty products. Heart is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other materials for the fishing business.

Heart has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing net and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 25 years old and married to Orlando. She has a retail shop where she sells products such as canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy other products that she can offer like noodles, canned goods, snack foods and candies.

Jocelyn hopes that someday she can expand her business to achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, snack foods and candies for her store.

loans.name: Lean

texts.en: Lean is 39 years old and is a married woman with seven children between the ages of 1 and 13. Lean's husband works as a government employee. Lean has been in the business of raising hogs for three years. She plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. Lean earns about 10,000 PHP per month with her business. Lean hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to improve their house and sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is a 46-year-old married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. Her husband works as a farmer and driver. Herminia has been an Avon dealer for 24 years. In addition to Avon products, she also sells ready-to-wear clothes to the people in her community. Herminia plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shoes, sandals and clothes. Herminia hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and clothes to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 57 and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is single. She enjoys working at her business, which helps to support her daily expenses and enables her to extend help to her family.

Alicia sells food. She buys raw vegetables, meats, and rice. She prepares and cooks different delicacies and sells them to her neighbors, passers-by, tricycle drivers, and other people in her local community. She also sells charcoal and delivers mineral water based on orders from her neighbors. She earns 800 PHP in daily sales.  

She is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP that will help her to have additional capital. She will utilize the loan to buy more raw meats, vegetables, rice, and charcoal. The loan will help her to meet the demands of customers, which will help her to earn more profit.    

Alicia hopes that her business will grow and that she will earn more profits. Her goal is to help her family. She dreams of having her own bakery someday. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* that helps her to gain more knowledge about the goodness of God to everyone. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as raw meats, vegetables, and rice.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 58 years old and single.  She is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She owns a variety store where she sells groceries such as canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She enjoys running her store that provides for her daily needs and expenses. 
 
Juanita earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She is also involved in the direct selling business and rug making. These businesses allow her to have additional income. 

Juanita's store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Juanita is requesting a loan for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more groceries and other products that will accommodate the demands of her customers. More items displayed at the store helps her to attract more customers and increase her profits, which will help her save money for her future.

Juanita hopes that her business will grow and become more successful. She dreams of having her own bakery that will enable her to extend help to her family who are in need. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as the words from the Bible inspires her to be stronger and also allows her to grow more spiritually. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Bible, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products for her store.

loans.name: Washington

texts.en: Washington is a married man with one child and also takes care of his sister. He lives in Hoima, Uganda. He owns a house and his goal is to educate his family members. He has been running a produce business for 5 years in which he mainly buys and sells at a margin. He has high hopes for the future and he believes his business is going to grow. He is requesting a loan to buy maize produce for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
This is Rosa, 47, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, 53, a printing press operator. She is a mother to four children, three are now working and the youngest is in high school. Rosa, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosa owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosa is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries and products that will accommodate the demands of her customers. She believes that having more display of items will definitely attract more customers to buy and it means more profit. She will save her profits for the educational expenses of her children.  

Rosa hopes that her business will grow in order to have a comfortable life. She dreams that her children will continue working and have their own income. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* as it gives her time to read and share her understandings and opinions about the word of God. It makes her a better person and Christian. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old and married with 4 children. The oldest child is 15 years old. Victoria's husband works as a carpenter.

Victoria sells dried fish and tablea (cocoa chocolate tablets) to the people in her community. She also sells purified water. Victoria has had her business for 3 years. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as water, dried fish and tablea. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as water, dried fish and tablea

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is  46 years old and single.  She is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines.  Joana operates a tailoring business.  She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing such as uniforms are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Running her business allows her to sustain her daily expenses and extend help to her family.

Joana's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 PHP daily.  

Joana is requesting a lona for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more quantities of fabric, thread, and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  

Joana dreams of having her own house, helping her nieces finish their studies, and saving enough for the future. She continuously attends the weekly fellowship.*  

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Bible, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children. Her husband works as a driver. 

Elsa runs a sari-sari (general) store business in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She sells items like toothpaste, shampoo and soft drinks. Elsa also sells corn and rice to the people in her community. 

Each month, Elsa earns 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, corn and rice. Elsa hopes for her business to grow and to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, corn and rice

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a farmer for eight years, focusing on coffee, vanilla, and bananas.  He also raises goats.  He started with a small piece of land but now has three acres. Nelson also does carpentry to supplement his income for the well-being of his family. 

Nelson is requesting for a loan, which he will use to buy more land for his coffee plantation. His hardship is limited capital; his vision is to have more acres of land so that his plantation will be able to generate high levels of produce leading to higher income.

loans.use: To purchase land for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
This is Julita, 49, a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Gil, a fruit vendor. She is the mother of seven children, most of whom are married and working, though one is still looking for a job. Julita doesn’t want to be idle while staying at home. She values her time so much that she wants to be profitable even if she’s staying at home.

Julita owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and other primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns 600 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting an 8,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries that will accommodate the demands of her customers. She believes that having more items on display will definitely attract more customers to buy, and that means more profit. She will save her profit for the educational expenses of her grandchildren.  

Julita hopes that her business will grow in order to help her grandchildren who are studying. She dreams of having her house repaired. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship*, as it inspires her to be a more God-fearing and God-loving individual. "It helps me to become a mature Christian in words and deeds."  

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Fhevie

texts.en:
This is Fhevie, 45, a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Willie, a driver, and is the mother of two children, both in elementary school. She enjoys attending to both her children and her business. The business allows her to help her husband cover their daily expenses. 

Fhevie operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Fhevie’s for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Fhevie dreams of being able to give her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* meetings that allow her to devote a few minutes of her time to studying and sharing God’s word. She values what is being shared and discussed in their weekly fellowship meetings. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials she needs in her business

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилджон умный и ответственный человек. Он женат и любящий отец троих детей. Он занимается услугами маршрутного такси более трех лет и имеет хорошего опыта в данном бизнесе. Комилджон также занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, а также скотоводством. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Комилджон хотел бы получит займ в размере 2500$ США. Часть займа он хочет использовать для ремонта своего автомобиля, а другую часть для покупки крупного рогатого скота, а также корм для них.
texts.en: Komiljon is a smart and responsible person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He has been involved in providing a taxi service along a specific route for over three years and has a good experience in this business.  Komiljon is also involved in growing agricultural crops and animal husbandry.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  Komiljon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500.  He wants to use a portion of the loan to make repairs to his car, and the other portion to buy cattle and fodder for it.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car, buy livestock and fodder for it

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is a 44-year-old married woman from Loon, Bohol. She has no children. Nilda runs a small sari-sari store. She sells coffee, canned goods, vinegar, and other kinds of products. Nilda also cooks viands that she sells to the people in her community. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell, as well as ingredients such as meat and vegetables. Nilda hopes to have a progressive life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, and ingredients such as meat and vegetables

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a fifty-nine-year-old widow with seven children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.  Annet operates a stationery shop, a business she has been running for seven years. In addition to her stationery business, Annet has started a poultry farm which enables her to increase the avenues of income for her family. Her hardships include price fluctuations.  Annet hopes that her poultry business will gain momentum and become a success. She is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed for her poultry business.

loans.use: buy chicken feed

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 52 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. She has a billiards business in Loon, Bohol. Lucia also sells coffee to the people in her community. She requested this loan to buy billiards materials and more coffee to sell. Lucia dreams for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy billiards supplies and coffee

loans.name: Baptista

texts.en:
Baptista is married man and has six children. He lives in Hoima, Uganda. Baptista is a farmer and has been in this business for 16 years. At times, due to poor methods used to market his produce, he finds it challenging to sell his produce at a good price. 

Baptista is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy land for his maize farm.  He believes that his agriculture venture will continue to grow in the future. His goal is to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase land for his maize farm.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson 39 years old, a father of four children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been a farmer for five years.  He started with half an acre of land, and now has four acres of land. Johnson both farms and sells bananas and coffee. His hardship is insufficient capital, and his vision is to have a modern commercial farm and to educate his family. Johnson is requesting a loan to enable him buy coffee and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Cirenea

texts.en:
Cirenea is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She runs an eatery business in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. Cirenea cooks the food that she sells. She also sells soft drinks, canned goods, and coffee. Cirenea earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Cirenea is requesting a loan to buy items such as pork,  chicken, meat, vegetables, spices, and soft drinks. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pork, chicken, meat, vegetables, spices, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gulnar's Group

texts.en:
Gulnar is the leader of this group. She is 49 and married to a cattle breeder. Together with her husband she has three sons and four daughters. The youngest son is eight (he goes to school) and the youngest daughter is just three years old. In order to earn money for their livelihood the family cultivates agricultural products.  

Gulnar sells apples, pears, potatoes and wheat. The price for apples and pears is 15 soms per kilogram and a kilo of potatoes costs 5 soms. Her monthly profit from this activity is about 5000 soms. With money received from the loan she plans to purchase wheat seeds to grow more wheat. In the near future she wants to finish their house construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a 38-year-old woman, married with three children aged between 3 and 18 years old. She is a hard-working farmer. She lives in Hoima in Western Uganda in her own house built out of her hard work as a farmer. For 10 years now, Daisy has been involved in farming both at subsistence and commercial levels. She started the agriculture business with one acre of land but now has 5 acres of farmland. She has high hopes for the future since she believes her farm will continue to improve. She is requesting for a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and also pay costs for labor working on her farmland.

loans.use: To buy improved seeds for planting, fertilizers, and pay for labor costs for her farmland.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She sells purified water, firewood and dried fish to the people in her community. She plans to raise pigs to augment her income.

 Isabel does her best to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase piglets and more items to sell such as dried fish and purified water. Isabel hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and more items to sell such as dried fish and purified water.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается скотоводством более 23 года. Она имеет 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и 1 голов овца. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищное условие и запрашивает займ в размере 10000 Сомони на построение дома, а также покупка шифера. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a hardworking and goal-oriented woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of three children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 23 years.  Gulbahor has three heads of cattle and one head of sheep.  She wants to improve her living conditions and is requesting a loan in the sum of 10 000 Somoni to build a house and to buy slates.  She thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to build a house and buy slates

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is a businessman living in Masindi, Uganda. He is in the clothing business mainly selling used clothing which most people in his area wear. He says he hopes to improve on the business's current status from being at a  market stall to a modern boutique. 

Norman adds that prices are constantly changing whenever he buys the products he sells, something he says is a big challenge for him as he finds it difficult to pass on the price increase burden to his customers. Norman wants a loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell at his market stall.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Hường is a 35-year-old woman living in a town in the Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Hường owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from raising ducks for sale.  Hường has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Hường joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hường has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  Hường is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase poultry feed & other supplies.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Hường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hường H. là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Hường Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi vịt để bán.  Hường thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hường kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Hường đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hường đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Hường dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man, a 40-year-old living in Phu Man commune, has two children, both of whom attend high school. A member of our credit program since 2007, she has received five previous loans, each averaging 7,000,000 VND. The loans have enabled Man to gradually expand the scale of her grocery shop to the point where she can earn 200,000 VND of profit per month, an income that allows her to manage the daily expenses of life and provide a good education for her children.

Always punctual in her repayments, Man is requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND to buy additional new products to meet customer demand. She hopes to earn more income to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy new products to expand her small grocery shop.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she is bringing up a daughter and two sons. The first son helps his mom in running their business, and the younger son and the daughter study at school.
