Two years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Aigul purchased candies, cookies and macaroni for resale. Since that time she has been selling household products and at the moment her monthly profit is about 4000 soms. 

She is applying for the loan because she needs additional funds to increase the commodity turnover of her business. With money received from the loan Aigul will purchase cookies, beverages and detergents. In the future she dreams of expanding her business and opening her own grocery store. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, detergents and cookies.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом житель района Шахритус. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. У них четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Илхом при доме имеет земельный участок, где он выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа топлива, семян лука и селитры, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Ilhom is a resident of the Shahrituz region. He is 41 years old, married and has four children. His wife works in the collective farm. Ilhom has a plot of land by his house where he grows vegetables for sale. He is taking out the loan to buy fuel, onion seeds and nitrate to sow and collect a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fuel, onion seeds and nitrate.

loans.name: Tiền

texts.en:
Tiền is a 56-year-old woman living in a town in Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Tiền owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Tiền has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Tiền joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tiền has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  Tiền is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Tiền plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tiền là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong - distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Tiền Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Tiền thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tiền kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Tiền đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tiền đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Tiền dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old. Avelino is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Avelino owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. He earns 40,000 PHP quarterly and has had this work for 4 years.

In 2010, Avelino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Avelino requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His future plan is to expand his farmland and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Sinar Kasih Group

texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old married with three children. They are eighteen, fifteen and ten years old. The older one already finished high school and the other two still go to school. 

Maria has been selling daily needs like eggs, oil and flour since 1981. She has a little kiosk near her house and people find it easy to access her kiosk. Her business is going well. She can help her husband who works for a publishing company to fulfill their family needs. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Indonesia, and now she wants to add more inventory to her kiosk.

She really likes running this business, because she can get extra money for her family and still can take care of her family. Her future plan for her children is have enough savings to send them to university. Also in the future she wants to open a bigger kiosk or even more, she would like to open a branch of her store.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her kiosk such as flour, eggs, and oil.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 32 years old with two children, and she is living in Phu Man commune.  To earn a daily income, she opened a  shop that sells food for vegetarians in 1991. Her business is much developed since she has  had more capital that she received from SEDA's micro-credit program since 2007.  Now,  every day, she can make 200,000 VND in profit. With this income, she can manage her family's expenditures well.  Since she joined our program, she has always been in a good repayment situation. 

 For the new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 VND  to buy more kinds of food  to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of food for vegetarians.

loans.name: Munhshur

texts.en:
Munhshur is 23 years old and lives with her mother and sister in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her mother works in a health organization and her sister is a college student. 

Munhshur started her garment retail business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. Her business has been sustainable ever since. Now that winter is arriving, she needs to buy warm clothes to sell. Therefore, Munhshur is requesting a long for 600,000 MNT, wich she will use to buy winter clothing. She is a bright and diligent woman who wants to open a store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase winter garments.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva  is 66 years old, widowed, and has four adult children.  She is from Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, Primitiva owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She earns 5,000 PHP a month and has been in this business for five years. 

Primitiva has been a member of GDMPC for almost six years. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.  Primitiva is requesting a new loan for 20,000 PHP,  which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, Primitiva's plans to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.ru: Валижон проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование, шафер. По специальности Валижон работает 15 лет. Кроме того он работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Еще он по сезону занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Так как зимою цены на скот понижены. Валижон зимою закупает телят а потом весною продает их по более высокой цене. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа телят и коровы.
texts.en: Valijon lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has five children. He has secondary education with specialized emphasis, he is a driver. Valijon has worked in his profession for fifteen years. He also works in the collective farm and also breeds large horned cattle during the season. During the winter the prices on the cattle are lower. Valijon buys calves in the winter and then sells them in the spring at a higher price. He has been in this business for three years. He is taking out the loan to buy calves and a cow.

loans.use: to buy calves and a cow.

loans.name: Aijamal's Group

texts.en:
Aijamal is a member of this group. She is 31 years old, married to a mechanic, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  

Aijamal works in a pharmacy; she started this job three years ago. Her monthly salary is 5,000 soms. She is requesting a loan, which she will use  to purchase children’s furniture. In the future, Aijamal hopes to open a private pharmacy. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase children's furniture.

loans.name: Jerry James

texts.en:
Jerry James is from Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry James operates a transportation service. He has been in this business for over ten years and earns PHP 10,000.00 a month.

Jerry James has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000.00 which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jerry James from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Bahri

texts.ru: Бахри проживает в районе Шахритус. Она разведена. Ей 48 лет. У нее трое детей. Ее дети уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сама Бахри занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения мужской и женской одежды, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Bahri lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 48 years old, divorced and has three children.  Her children left to go work in the Russian Federation.  Bahri is involved in sales of food products and has been in this business for 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of men's and women's clothing in order to expand the assortment of her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Jocylin

texts.en: Jocylin is 40 years old and is a married woman with four children. They are from one to twenty-two years old. She has been in the business of raising hogs for eight years. Jocylin plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins. Each month, Jocylin earns 10,000 PHP with her business. Jocylin hopes for her business to be progressive. She also wishes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara is the leader of this group. She is 42 and she is a widow. She has a nineteen-year-old daughter who is handicapped. In order to earn money, two years ago Anara started to sell dishes. She earns 5000 soms per month. The profit made it possible for her to purchase furniture for her home and to improve their living conditions. At the moment, Anara wants to start to sell hosiery, but she needs financial funds to start this business. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase hosiery products for resale. In the future, she wishes to save money to purchase an apartment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hosiery products for resale

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman from Loon, Bohol. She has been in the business of raising hogs for 15 years. Carolina works hard to support her family. She also ventured into tailoring to augment her income.

Carolina has requested a loan to purchase hog feed and vitamins. Carolina hopes to sustain her children's education and pay her obligations through her business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: 49-year-old Esmeralda has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 20 years. She is married and has three children. Esmeralda sells various products like soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar and vinegar. She also sells coconut wine and prepaid mobile load (cell phone minutes) to the people in her community. Esmeralda works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as coconut wine, prepaid mobile load and canned goods. Esmeralda hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as coconut wine, prepaid mobile  load (cellphone minutes)  and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush is engaged in agricultural business. Siranush would like to enlarge her business, for which she needs sufficient financial means. With the requested loan, Siranush plans to purchase livestock and forage. This will allow her to develop farming and get additional income, which will help her to renovate her house and  sustain improved living conditions for her family.  Siranush lives together with her husband, two children, her mother-in-law and her father-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Она трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Более 19 лет она занимается купля продажей овощей на местном рынке. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищное условие и обеспечить своих детей, с этой целью она работает усердно с утра до вечера. Насиба хотела бы получит займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки овощей с целью расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Nasiba is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is a hardworking and conscientious woman.  She has been involved in buying and selling vegetables at the local market for over 19 years.  Nasiba wants to improve her living conditions and provide for her children, and this is why she diligently works from dawn until dusk.  Nasiba wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 Somoni for the purchase of vegetables in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa is engaged in agriculture. She keeps fruits and vegetables in the freezer to sell during the winter season. To meet the rising demand for frozen fruits Larisa would like to keep fruit not only from her orchard. With the requested loan Larisa plans to purchase more fruit. This loan will help Larisa to increase her business income and insure a brighter future for her family. Larisa lives together with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for extra fruit to freeze and sell in winter.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is 54 years old and has been engaged in running an eatery business for more than 17 years. Over these years of operating this kind of occupation, she paid for her two children to finish their studies. She gets all the expenses used for their education from her business. She struggled a great deal to promote their education, but because of her courage and faith in God, she completed her sacrifice.


Right now, she wants to recover all that was spent. Therefore Emilie is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed in her eatery such as vegetables, meat and "pancit". This would be a great factor to increase her sales every day. She is thankful that Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. give her an opportunity to borrow an additional working capital to improve her current business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed in her eatery such as vegetables, meat and "pancit" (noodles).

loans.name: Relania

texts.en:
Relania is 26 years old and is a married woman with two children aged 3 and 6. Relania's husband works as a driver.

Relania has been in the business of raising hogs for four years. She earns 3000 PHP per month. Relania also runs a small eatery. She works hard to support her family and save for her children's education. She requested this loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. Relania hopes to earn more and start building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Papag

texts.en: Papag is engaged in agriculture. He keeps sheep and cultivates potatoes and beans. Papag would like to develop his business and and keep livestock, too. With the requested loan, Papag plans to purchase livestock, forage, fuel and seeds.  With the help of this loan, Papag will enlarge his business and increase his income. This will allow him to improve his family's living conditions. Papag lives together with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for livestock, forage, fuel and seeds.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old, married and has a two-year-old child.  To earn a living, he runs a greengrocery, mainly selling bananas.  He has been in the business for four years.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business.

Daniel hopes to expand his business in five years.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a 36-year-old, hard-working lady; she is married to Richard and they have four children.

Oliver operates a shop, a business she has done for the last two years, selling basic household items and foodstuffs like bread, milk, and sugar. In a month, she makes an income of KES 30,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD and she will use it to buy cooking fat, baking flour, sugar, bread, rice and soft drinks for sale.

She will use the business profits to expand her business since she aspires to open a wholesale shop. Apart from this she intends to educate her children well and also provide their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like sugar, rice and cooking oil to stock for sale.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором замужем имеет троих детей. Муж предприниматель. Воспитание малолетних детей требует больших вкладов. Надо уделить внимание их здоровью, начальному обучению, питанию. Она на рынке торгует детской одеждой. Для содержания семьи она тратит часть полученной прибыли. Для подготовки к зиме и расширения ассортимента товара она хочет получить займ в размере 1500 Сомони и закупить новый товар. Она надеется  на получение займа  который поможет обновить ассортимент и закупить зимнюю детскую одежду. Она заранее благодарна вам и надеется на ваше великодушие.
texts.en: Dilorom is married and has three children.  Her husband is an entrepreneur.  Raising small children requires large investments, such as paying attention to their health, early education and nutrition.  Dilorom sells children's clothing at a market.  She spends part of the received profit to support her family.  In anticipation of winter, Dilorom wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1500 Somoni to buy new merchandise and expand her merchandise selection.  She hopes to get this loan, which will help her update her selection and buy children's winter clothing.  She thanks you in advance and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Payka

texts.ru: Пайка проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем. У них двое детей. Ее муж строитель. Сама она при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян пшеницы.
texts.en: Payka lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Payka has a small plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for over 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 30-year-old farmer. She is married and a mother to a 7-year-old child. Apart from farming, Teresia runs a retail shop and a grocery. She has engaged in these two business for 5 years. She has retained her businesses because of her hard work. She is also grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her to grow her business because of their financial support.

Teresia desires to become financially stable in the future. She needs 100,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно замужем имеет троих детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Для содержания своей семьи она занимается откормом скота, выращиванием картошки и переработкой абрикосов и яблок. Это тяжело для женщины, но для содержания детей приходится выполнять тяжелый труд. Желание каждых родителей вырастит детей в достатке и дать им образование. Это требует огромных усилий и вкладов. Она хочет получить займ и приобрести крупный рогатый скот. После откорма продать и получить хорошую прибыль. Она надеется на вашу помощь  и заранее приносит свою благодарность.
texts.en: Barno is married and has three children.  Her husband is working in Russia.  In order to support her family, Barno is involved in fattening up livestock, growing potatoes and processing apricots and apples.  All of this is difficult for a woman, but she must do this hard labor to provide for her children.  It is a desire of every parent to raise their children in abundance and provide them with education.  This requires enormous efforts and investments.  Barno wants to obtain this loan and purchase cattle.  She then wants to fatten it up, sell it and make a good profit.  Barno relies on your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en: Goharik works at the local kindergarten. Unfortunately, her salary is too low to make ends meet, so she is also engaged in agriculture. Goharik grows fruits and vegetables and keeps them in the freezer to sell for the coming winter season. Goharik would like to sell more fruit. For this reason she plans to purchase fruit. Goharik has to keep the fruit in a rented freezer. Increase of sales will allow her to construct her own freezer in the future. Goharik will soon have her first child, so this will help her to get additional income and ensure a sustainable future for her child. Goharik lives together with her husband, mother-in-law and father-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for fruit

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 36 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 16 years old. Maribeth's husband works as a driver.

Maribeth sells hotdogs and ham to the people in her community. She and her husband also make "empanada" (a kind of small meat pie) to sell. Maribeth requested this loan to buy more hotdogs and ham to sell. Maribeth hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more hotdogs and ham to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan keeps livestock and cultivates land. She would like to develop farming and enlarge her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase livestock and forage. This loan will help Susan to ensure sustainable living conditions for her family and her son's family in the future. Susan lives together with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren is 56 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. The elder two kids are employed and live separately. The younger one is a college student. She started her dairy retail business in 2000 by renting a counter in a local market. She has gained many guaranteed suppliers over the years and she has many regular customers as well. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "My youngest daughter is the only one in a family who gets to go to college therefore, I will do everything i can to support her". She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy more dairy products.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 48 years old and is a married woman with three children between 14 and 22 years old. She has a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Remedios sells items like canned goods, soap and noodles. She works hard to improve her business and support her family. Remedios has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, canned goods and noodles. Remedios hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy more rice, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is 24 years old with two children living in Phu Man village. Her husband is a carpenter. Therefore, they opened a wood workshop to make wooden furniture in 2006. Through a neighbor, she learned about SEDA's credit program in 2009 and obtaining more capital to expand her workshop. She can achieve 4,000,000 VND of profit from this kind of business.  Regarding her last loan, she received 6,944,000 VND that she used for maintaining her cutting machine. To meet more and more orders from her customers, she hopes to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy more wood.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 35 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is nine years old. Rosalina's husband is a fisherman.

Rosalina is a seaweed farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in this business for nine years. Rosalina earns about 5000 PHP per month with her business. She also helps her husband sell his catch at the market. 

Rosalina requested this loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs

loans.name: Nerses

texts.en: Nerses has been engaged in farming during the past 4 years, through which he managed to create favorable conditions to develop the business. This requires some financial investments. With the help of this loan, Nerses will purchase livestock and enlarge the farm. This is very important for Nerses and his family, as development of agriculture will allow him to stay in the community, sustain his family, and not have to leave for work abroad. Nerses lives together with his wife and two children.

loans.use: to pay for livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 24 years old and a single lady. She has operated a retail shop for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 16,100.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of registered clients with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy sugar, sweets, soft drinks and wheat flour for sale.

She will save the anticipated profits  and pay school fees for her child. In future she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sugar,  sweets, soft drinks  and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: 60-year-old Sabina is a married woman with eight children. She sells fish for a living. Sabina also built a small store where she sells rice, gasoline and soft drinks. Sabina earns about 8000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to buy more fish, rice, gasoline and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish, rice, gasoline and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has  three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).

Lillian has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for five years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Lillian sells her products at the market, retail. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through working as a women councilor in her village.

The main business challenges for  Lilian include ever increasing prices  of  bananas and high transportation  costs. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and be a wholesaler. Lilian lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 53 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Isabelita is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Isabelita has been raising pigs for 36 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for raising pigs

loans.name: Badarch

texts.en:
Badarch is 64 years old and lives with her husband in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She has two kids who are employed and live separately. Her husband is retired. 

Badarch started her cosmetics and garment retail business in 2003 by renting a counter in the local market. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to buy warm clothes to sell. She is a strong and hard-working woman who says, "My business has been expanding rapidly in the last few years and I don't want to weaken that speed." She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy winter coats, woolen pants, and winter boots.

loans.use: To buy winter coats, woolen pants, and  winter boots.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: A married woman with five children, 51-year-old Severina runs a sari-sari store in Trinidad, Bohol, selling items like soap, canned goods and vinegar. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP with her business. Now requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, canned goods and soft drinks, Severina hopes to soon see improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 52 years old and married with 1 child.

Liza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling of charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Liza has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been in the business of buying and selling of charcoal for 3 years and also earns an income from fish retail.

Liza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en: Vagharshak grows and sells mushrooms. He buys mushroom seeds, grows them and sells them. To increase the effectiveness of the production process, Vagharshak would like to grow mushroom seeds himself. With the requested loan he plans to purchase equipment to grow mushroom seeds. With the help of this loan Vagharshak will develop his business and increase his working capital. With additional income Vagharshak will ensure a sustainable future for his family. Vagharshak lives together with his wife, son and daughter.

loans.use: to pay for equipment to grow mushroom seeds

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 7 years. Mary Grace earns more income from fish vending.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for maintenance

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 32 years old and married with 1 child.

Tita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Tita has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Tita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Maguy

texts.en:
Maguy, a 48-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children, both of whom attend school, has been running a tailoring shop since 2005. Having worked for 21 years in tailoring, she is well-known in her town and surrounding areas.

Maguy, who produces clothes which she sells to multiple customers and clothing stores, is now requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional textiles. In the future, she hopes to expand her business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase additional textiles.

loans.name: Safaroy

texts.ru: Сафарой жительница Яванского района. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Сафарой более восьми лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Safaroy is a resident of the Yavan district.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is in Russia.  Safaroy has been involved in animal husbandry for over eight years.  She breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Aleli

texts.en:
Aleli is 48 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aleli has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.. 

Aleli is requesting a loan for 13,500 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy rice for her business. Aleli would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice for her food vending business

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is single  and works hard to support her family. She has a snack food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Angeline is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use  to buy more snack foods to sell.  Angeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks  to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 34 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.  Geraldine runs a sari sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.  She sells a variety of items such as detergents, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Geraldine is requesting a loan for  20,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more items to sell.  Geraldine would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien is 35 years old with 3 children who are in high school. They live in Phu Man village. Joining SEDA's credit program in 2010, she received a loan of 5,152,000 VND to open her small grocery store. Her business is running quiet well. It generates a profit of 150.000 VND. This income helps her a lot in managing her family's lifestyle. In the process of repayment, she is always in a good situation. As group leader, she will encourage other members in her group to complete their repayment punctually.

Thanh is 46 years old with 2 children. She is a farmer and focuses on growing rice and raising chickens and pigs. For this new loan cycle, she requires a loan of 7,392,000 VND.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of products to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Oyunerdene

texts.en: Oyunerdene is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in Ger, Mongolian yurt in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband works at a construction site and her kids are school students. She started her tailoring business in 2009 with her friend. Mostly, she sews traditional clothes (deel). Now that her customers are increasing, she needs to buy a more powerful and fast sewing machine. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "My business is expanding and I want to keep up with it". She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is the married mother of 10 children, and works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling flowers in the Philippines, and supplements her income by selling vegetables. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more flowers to sell to her customers. This will be her third loan, which she is applying for after repaying her first two loans fully and on time. She hopes that hard work will help her reach her dream of building and expanding her own flower shop.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Letecia has a personal products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more personal products like body lotions, perfumes, etc. to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products like body lotions, perfumes etc. to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 57 years old and married with three children. Luciana is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a Sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Luciana requested a PHP 13,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Luciana has been in this business for six years. In the future, Luciana would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 48 year old single mother of two children, aged 12 and 24. She has been operating a green grocery, for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 8,000.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a registered client of KADET LTD. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more tomatoes for sale.

The anticipated profits she will save and use to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a flowers sales business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more flowers to sell in her stall.

Lilibeth has been in this business for two years. Lilibeth earns more income from fruit and vegetable vending.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college and repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат замужем и мать троих детей. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Её муж работает в Кирпичном заводе и его зарплата не хватает на содержании семьи и чтобы помогать мужу она начала заниматься торговлей 13 лет назад. В начала она занималась купля продажей женских одежд, а потом постепенно перешла на продажу детской и женской обуви. Сегодняшний день она успешно продолжает этот бизнес и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Она всегда привозить высококачественные сезонные обуви, поэтому её товары продаются хорошо на рынке. Каромат хотела бы получит займ для покупки зимних обувей и заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Karomat is married and is a mother of three children.  She is a smart and hardworking woman.  Her husband works at a brick factory, however, his salary is not sufficient to support the family, so Karomat began involved in sales 13 years ago in order to help her husband.  At first, she was involved in selling women's clothing and then gradually transitioned to selling children's and women's shoes.  Today, Karomat successfully continues this business and has many loyal customers.  She always brings in high-quality seasonal shoes, and this is why her merchandise sell well at the market.  Karomat wants to obtain a loan to buy winter shoes and thanks all of you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase winter shoes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 23 years old and has three children. She has a common-law husband and has two children who are in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Myrna has been farming vegetables for a year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her little business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 55 years old, married and has three children.  He does quarrying to earn a living.  He has been in the business for six years and has employed two people.  Besides quarrying, he practices dairy farming to earn extra income.  He has grown his business through Faulu Kenya.  This has helped him to educate his children.

Simon has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane earns a living by selling school and office supplies, and is applying for a loan to expand her business by buying a larger variety of items to sell to her customers. Demand for her products has been strong, and she believes that this loan will increase her income and allow her to provide a better life for her husband and her two sons, both of whom are in school.

loans.use: to buy more school and office supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 35 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Olivia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Olivia has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from her Sari-Sari (variety) Store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Butelt

texts.en:
Butelt is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in Ger, Mongolian yurt in Bulgan province of Mongolia. His wife is a janitor of a bank, elder daughter is a school student, and younger one goes to kinder-garden. 
He runs a taxi service using his own car. He is a well-experienced driver. Now that winter is approaching, his car needs maintenance. He is a strong and hardworking man who says, "I have a bright vision of running my own taxi company". He is requesting 650,000 MNT to buy winter tires and spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy winter tires and spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Patricia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Patricia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Raquel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a purified drinking water business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit and vegetable vending. Remedios is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of water for her water refilling business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of water for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee is 50 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ger, Mongolian yurt in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, elder three kids live independently, and her daughter is a college student. 
She rents space to run a grocery shop. Now that winter is approaching, she wants to buy some vegetables before prices go high. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "I struggled my life to support my children. Now that my children are old enough, it is time for me to concentrate on my business which i wanted to expand for years". She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy grocery products from Ulaanbaatar at wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Muộn's Group

texts.en:
Muộn is a 50-year-old female living in the Yen Phong district in Bac Ninh province.  Muộn is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 1.

Muộn is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Muộn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Muộn has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Muộn joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Muộn is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.   She is a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.   Muộn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Thức  is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising chickens.

2.  Ban is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising pigs and chickens.

3.  Phương Nam is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising pigs.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Muộn  là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Muộn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt 1 - nhóm 06 (6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Muộn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Muộn kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Muộn đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Muộn đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Thức là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Ban là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Phương Nam là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Sylvia's Group

texts.en:
Sylvia's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Sylvia is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her farm supply shop, which sells seeds and equipment to local farmers. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more farm tools for resale, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and take care of her family. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to save money to buy a plot of land, and to open other branches of her shop. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sylvia's future prospects by helping her to learn more about how to save and how to be financially literate.

loans.use: buy farm tools to resell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old and married with one child.  He has been operating a retail shop for four years. He has managed to retain his business through his hard work and determination.  He has also grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.

Joseph hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is from the village of Panay, Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old. Miguel is married and has two children. To make a living, Miguel owns & operates transportation services and from this he earns 5,000 PHP per month. He has been doing this work for three years. 

Miguel joined GDMPC in 2007 and he has been a member of  GDMPC for almost 4 years.  Miguel is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts and repair his vehicle for better usage. 

Miguel plans to improve the general living conditions of his family and his business as well.

loans.use: buy spare parts and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Mendjargal

texts.en:
Mendjargal is 31 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a mongolian yurt, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife runs a sewing business at home.   

Mendjargal  started a taxi business in 2009 using his own car. His daily income is 10,000 - 15,000 MNT.  Now that his wife is starting a business, he wants to support her by buying her a sewing machine and raw materials.  His wife is a certified tailor and very talented.  There are no decent tailor shops around the neighborhood. 

Mendjargal is a strong and diligent man who says "my wife is very talented on sewing and more importantly she loves it so I will do everything I can in order to support her".  He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase sewing materials and a sewing machine for her wife's business.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine and sewing materials for his wife's business

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 37-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with one parent and a sibling. He has owned a carpentry business for the past eight years. He works very hard to earn good income and has two full-time employees helping him achieve the work tasks.  

With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, Iyad will be able to purchase more wood for his business. He reports that both his business productivity and income will be increased as a result of the loan.

loans.use: buy wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 34-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Abeer is selling clothes from her home since she can't afford the expenses of renting a store. Abeer is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes to meet the increased demands from the neighborhood.

Abeer is looking to expand her business by contracting with nearby shops to sell her products.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the picture is Abeer's husband.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Undarmaa

texts.en:
Undarmaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger, a mongolian yurt, in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband is a road specialist, her older two kids go to school and younger one goes to kindergarten. 

Undarmaa  started her garment retailing business recently by renting a counter in a local market. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to buy warmer clothes to retail.  She is a strong and diligent woman who says "Now that I have three kids to support I have to do my business more active."   She is requesting 1,670,000 MNT to buy garments from Erlian.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 54 years old, married, and has three children.  He has been quarrying for six years to earn a living.  He also does dairy farming to earn extra income for his family.  He has boosted his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.

Antony is requesting a loan for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.  He hopes to venture into other businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ninjbadgar

texts.en:
Ninjbadgar is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger, a mongolian yurt, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, her eldest son is a college student and the younger one goes to school. 

Ninjbadgar started her business in 2003 by selling garments outdoors. Now, she rents a counter in a market.  She has a good fashion sense.  Now that winter is arriving, she wants to buy warm clothes to sell. 

Ninjbadgar  is a strong and diligent woman who says "I started this business from scratch. At first, I barely made a living out of it but now, I am feeding my family and paying my son's college tuition out of it".  She is requesting 1,800,000 MNT to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en: Salwa is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She has owned a small mini-market since 1998. Despite her older age, Salwa works hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs, especially with her husband’s absence as he is on travel. Today, she is requesting to borrow $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more merchandise for her grocery store in order to increase her sales and thus her income. In the future, she is looking to further expand her business and increase its capital.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 46, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines.  She and her husband, Ramon, have four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Elizabeth operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicures, pedicures, etc. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Elizabeth dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional supply of products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Khách

texts.en:
Khách is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, Khách owns and operates a manufacturing business.  The main source of income for this business comes from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Khách has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Khách joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help her improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Khách has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,736,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  

Khách is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND, which will be used to purchase machinery to expand her business.  This loan will be Khách’s sixth loan from SEDA.  Khách plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.



About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.





Khách là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Khách Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Khách thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Khách kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Khách đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Khách đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Khách dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase machinery to expand her business.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 47 years old and married.   She has nine children between the ages of 4 and 27. Belinda's husband works as a farmer and a Barangay official.

Belinda is also a farmer. She works with her husband tilling their land and growing rice crops. Belinda has been engaged in rice farming for ten years. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Belinda hopes to have a stable income that will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is 45 years old, married, and has four children, who attend school. Her husband makes spare parts. He has several business contacts and he supplies them spare parts on order. 

Kosar is a seamstress. She is very experienced in her work and has been a seamstress for 25 years. She receives a good number of orders every month from her neighborhood clients and fulfills them to earn profits. Her income has helped her children continue their education. 

Kosar is requesting a loan from Asasah to buy an overlock machine, which will help her provide overlock services to her customers along with sewing. This loan will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to make soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Erkaiym's Group

texts.en:
Erkaiym is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a mechanic, whose monthly salary is 6,000 KGS. Together with her husband she has raised two children, the older son is a farmer and the daughter studies at school; she is going to graduate this year. Two years ago the family started to breed livestock in order to resell it after fattening. With money received from the loan, Erkaiym wants to purchase two livestock animals for breeding, fattening and further resale. In the future with the profits gained from this activity, she plans to finish the house construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jeel

texts.en:
Jeel is a 26-year-old single lady from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Jeel has a home-based beauty salon and she is requesting a loan from 1,200 JD to purchase some new equipment and materials needed to meet the increased demands in her salon.

One of Jeel's aspirations is to open a licensed salon away from her home and she is looking to purchase her own car and house.

Due to cultural issues, the woman in the picture is Jeel's Mother.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and materials for her salon

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. In order to help his parents pay the life expenses, Hasan has worked in a small supermarket since 2005. At the same time, he is pursuing his education studying Business Administration, and this is his last year. Today, he is asking to borrow 1,000 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his courses at the university. Hasan is very ambitious and looks forward to begin working in a large company in order to gain income and be able to better support his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for his courses at the university

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda is a 26-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Warda is selling clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase more clothes to sell and expand her business.

Warda is looking to open a shop for her clothes so that she can increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the picture is Warda's husband.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George has made a living for the last nine years by selling bananas. He is applying for his second loan, for 50,000 Kenyan shillings, to buy more bananas to sell to his customers. He repaid his first loan, which was for 30,000 Kenyan shillings, fully and on time, and has succeeded in growing his business to the point where he now has three employees.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is an experienced furniture carpenter; he has owned a carpentry shop for almost 11 years. He is the main income provider of his family. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow 1,000 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an air compressor and other equipment needed to improve his business operation. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and other equipment needed

loans.name: Stenely

texts.en:
Stenely is 46 years old, married to Jane and a father of four school-going children. For the past 2 years, Stenely has operated a school with a monthly profit of 40,000 KES.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a registered client of KADET LTD. Stenely is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy books and pay rent.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide the basic needs for his family. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy books and pay rent

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 36 years old and single. She has 4 children whom she adopted. Three of those children are in school. Rose owns a restaurant which she has run for the last 7 years. The business has helped her to care for the children and her parents. She would like a loan to buy more equipment and inventory for her restaurant. She hopes to use the profits to buy a permanent space for the restaurant instead of renting.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 53-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a car mechanic for the past 21 years. Five years ago, he opened his own car repair shop and started to provide his customers with top quality repair services. And today, Ghassan is asking to borrow 800 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase car oils in large quantities. In the future, he plans to start selling spare car parts from his shop.

loans.use: to purchase car oils in large quantities

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia is 51 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Eustaquia is a food vendor. She makes banana and camote cue, rice cakes and other local delicacies. Eustaquia earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested this loan to purchase oil, sugar, bananas and flavoring. Eustaquia plans to use her profits to pay her children's school fees and save for a new house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, bananas and flavoring

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and a father for three children.

Ayed has owned a gallery for rental tables, chairs and canvas since 2004. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and he has sufficient experience in this field. His gallery is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $2,000 in order to purchase a large generator and to add more rental items. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large generator and to add more rental items.

loans.name: Shahadeh

texts.en:
Shahadeh is a 38-year–old man who married his wife in 2004 and had four adorable children.

Three years ago, Shahadeh opened a small store for mobile telephones sales, and through the years, he added many other services such as fixing mobiles, selling mobile accessories, and selling scented oils and perfumes.

Shahadeh has now applied for this loan so he can buy a few of the latest models of cell phones and renew the storefront.

loans.use: To add the latest models of cell phones and renew the store front.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 31 years old, married and blessed with a five-year-old child.  He earns a living by providing transportation services, and has done well in a competitive environment by providing excellent customer service. He supplements his income by raising cows, and is applying for a loan for 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two new diary cows to add to his herd.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows to add to his herd.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She has been selling women's accessories and beauty products since 2008. She works from her home where she welcomes customers to deal with them. With her loan request of 1,500 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., Hana will be able to increase her inventory of beauty products and accessories in order to attract more clientele. In the future, she hopes to open her own store.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of beauty products and accessories

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Larry is a married man with 2 children. His wife is a manicurist.

Larry does farming for a living. He grows vegetables to sell. Larry also started selling food to augment his income. He makes rice cakes and other delicacies that he sells to the people in his community. Larry requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, flour and sugar. Larry hopes for his businesses to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, flour and sugar

loans.name: Ainur's Group

texts.en:
Ainur is the leader of this group. She is 40 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She brings up three sons and a daughter. Ainur lives and a rural area, therefore she earns money by breeding livestock and reselling it after fattening. She started this business 12 years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 KGS and now her monthly profit is about 10,000 KGS. With money received from the loan, Ainur wants to increase the number of livestock, which will lead to an increase of commodity turnover. In the future, Ainur plans to purchase a vehicle because school, a hospital and the shops are far away.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en: Alexandre is 33-years-old with 2 children ages 1 and 8. The oldest child is currently in school. His wife works with him in his business of selling wood and wood handicrafts.
