He has been running this business for 2 years and would like the loan to buy more wood. He will use the profits to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more woods for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice’s group is comprised of three hard working women. Beatrice is 16-years-old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soap and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, soap and sugar for resale. This will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another retail shop. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Beatrice's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna keeps beehives and cultivates land. Anna would like to increase the number of beehives and enlarge her business. With the requested loan Anna plans to purchase beehives. This loan will help Anna to provide her family with better living conditions, as her salary from the local school and present income are barely enough to meet the ends. Anna lives with her husband and son. Development of beekeeping will also promote agriculture within the community.

loans.use: to purchase beehives

loans.name: Ma. Annabelle

texts.en:
Thirtysix-year-old, Ma. Annabelle, is a married woman with 3 children aged 13, 11 and 9. Her husband is a farmer.

Ma. Annabelle has had a sari-sari store business for 13 years. She sells items like canned goods, school supplies and soap. Each month Ma. Annabelle earns 4000 PHP with her business. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, biscuits and soap. Ma. Annabelle plans to use her profit to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 16-years-old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past year, Judith has been working hard to manage her small shop which sells firewood. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more firewood for resale. This will help Judith to generate greater profits and solve home problems. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Judith's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 28-year-old single man from Baqa'a, Jordan.

Yousef has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to make new decorations for the store.

Yousef is looking to expand his business by adding new products for his store, such as frozen food.

loans.use: to make new decorations for the store

loans.name: Phamela

texts.en: Eighteen-year-old Phamela is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. She and her husband are both farmers. Phamela's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Phamela does her best to improve their rice farm and take care of her child. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Phamela plans to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and the father of one child. 

Sabah is a blacksmith. In 2007, he opened a workshop making doors and windows. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well-known in the surrounding areas. Sabah is requesting a loan of $1800 to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Alen

texts.en: Alen is engaged in beekeeping. He would like to expand his business, for which he needs some financial investemnts. With the requested loan Alen plans to purchase beehives. Additional beehives will allow Alen to develop his beekeeping business and increase his income. This is very important for Alen and his family, as he plans to get married. Additional income will help his family in the future. Alen lives with his parents.

loans.use: to purchase beehives

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Her primary crop is rice, for which she earns about 3,000 PHP per month. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. She hopes this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 27 and is married to a house builder. She has 2 children aged 1 and 7. The elder child is currently in school. She owns a store where she sells cooking oil, rice, bananas, potatoes, spices, and personal items.  She has been running this shop for 2 years and would like a loan to expand the variety of goods she sells. Her business has helped her to support her family. She would like to use the profits from this loan to reinvest in her business and create some savings for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, oil, potatoes and spices to sell.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
Karar is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married, and lives with his wife.  

Karar has owned a barber shop since 2008. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers as well as a good reputation. He is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2,100 loan to renovate his shop and purchase a barber chair. He is hoping to earn more profits to afford him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and purchase a barber chair.

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Урозали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 32 года. Женат. Живет вместе с родителями. Его брат находится в России. Сам Урозали занимается растениеводством и скотоводством. Он берет кредит для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Urozali lives in the Yavan district.  She is 32 years old, married and lives together with his parents.  His brother is in Russia.  Urozali is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 33 years old, married, and has two children. He earns a living by selling electronics.  He has been in this business for eleven years and employs two people.  He also runs a cafeteria to earn extra income for his family.  Previously, he was farming.

Johnstone has been able to expand his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  With 50,000 Kenya shillings, he will buy speakers and amplifiers.

loans.use: to buy speakers and amplifiers.

loans.name: Ussama

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single, and lives with seven family members, one of whom also works.

Since 2007, Ussama has been the owner of an office where he distributes lines for the internet. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation.  He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a large generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large generator.

loans.name: Massamba Ndour

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme agé , marié et père de 4 enfants qui sont tous à l'école.Il est chauffeur dans une boulangerie de sa localité .En meme temps, il exerce le commerce de tissus et d'article de fete.Il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter des tissus "thioub" et "ganila" à l'occasion de la fete de "Tabaski".Il ambitionne d'acheter un véhicule et de me mettre en location.
texts.en: The borrower is an older married man, father to four children who are all in school. He is a delivery man for a bakery in his town. At the same time, he does business as a seller of fabrics and party products. He is asking for a loan for 1150000F to buy "thioub" and "ganila" fabrics for the Tabaski festival. He aspires to buy a vehicle and put it up for rentals.

loans.use: to buy "thioub" and "ganila" fabrics

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 31-year-old single man from Baqa'a, Jordan.

Marwan has an Aluminum shop and is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase more aluminum for his shop so that he can increase his production quantities and meet the extra demand.

Marwan is studying at university now and he is looking to improve and expand his shop by purchasing new machines so that he can increase his income and help his brother finance his education.

loans.use: to purchase more aluminum

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié polygamme avec deux épouses.Il est père de 4 enfants dont 2 sont à l'école.Il  dispose d'un taxi et  exerce l'activité de transport de marchandises pour les commercants.Il assure aussi le service de  déménagement.Avec cette activité, il entretient sa famille et est parvenu à construire une maison dont les travaux sont en phase de finition.C'est à cet effet qu'il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour réaliser un bloc de toillettes externes dans cette maison.Son ambition est d'acheter une nouvelle voiture.
texts.en: The borrower is a polygamist married man with two wives. He is father to four children, two of whom are in school. He practices the activity of transporting merchandise for shopkeepers. He also insures the moving service. With this activity, he takes care of his family and managed to build a house, for which the work is in its final stages. It is for this purpose that he asks for a loan of 500000f to make a block of external bathrooms in his house. His ambition is to buy a new car.

loans.use: to make a block of external bathrooms

loans.name: Kaed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married, and the father of one child. He lives with two family members.

Kaed has been an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are many customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $1800 in order to purchase two refrigerators and to make shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits so that he may provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: To purchase two refrigerators and to make shelves.

loans.name: Dilara's Group

texts.en: Dilara is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son. The son studies at school and the daughter is preschool age (under 7). In order to earn money for the family's livelihood, Dilara takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows. She invests the profits gained from this activity in livestock. Dilara applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay to feed the livestock during the winter season. In the future, she plans to finish the house construction. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock.

loans.name: Koitalel

texts.en:
Koitalel is a 43 year old man. He is married to Nasima, with whom he has four children. He has been in livestock trading for the last 11 years, and makes a monthly profit of KES 30,000.  

Koitalel was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a registered client of KADET LTD.  He is applying for his second loan, which he will use to buy more livestock to rear and sell later at a profit.  He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family’s basic needs. In the future he hopes to grow his business, and become a meat supplier to K.M.C.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père d'un enfant.Il pratique le commerce de bétail en achetant sur les marchés hebdommadaires.Il pratique cette activité depuis prés de 8 ans et arrive à générer des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, vestimentaires , scolaires et de santé de sa famille.Afin d'augmenter de préparer la féte de Tabaski durant laquelle il y 'a une forte demande  , il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 40 moutons. Son ambition est de faire de l'embouche ovine et bovine .
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who is father to one child. He trades in livestock and buys his animals at the weekly markets. He has been carrying out this activity for almost eight years and manages to generate sufficient profits to provide for his family's needs in terms of food, clothing, education and health. In preparation for the Tabaski festival, during which there is strong demand, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to buy 40 sheep. His ambition is to practise both sheep and beef fattening.

loans.use: to buy 40 sheep

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 29 years old and is married with 2 children, aged 2 and 5.  The elder child is currently in school. She runs a store where she sells foodstuffs such as maize, bananas, sorghum, sweet potatoes, potatoes and rice.  She would like a loan to expand her inventory of foodstuffs to sell. She has been running this business for 3 years and it has helped her care for her family. She will use the profits from this loan to create savings for her future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 34-year-old married Lebanese man living with his parents, wife and five children. Since 2007 he has owned a shoe shop, where he puts different trends and brands on the market. He has obtained his first Kiva loan; he has always been a reliable client with punctuA. payments. With his requested loan of $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, he plans to add a small corner in his shop where he will sell women’s bags and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Mary is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Mary has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which serves hot meals to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for the hotel, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget.

loans.use: to purchase more food for the hotel

loans.name: Cheikh Dahi

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de 4 enfants dont deux sont à l'école.Il est maçon de formation.Il exerce ce métier mais pratique égaleùent l'agriculture et l'élevage.Il dispose de 4 ha de terre sur lesquelles il cultive de l'arachide, du mil et du maïs.Chaque année, il achéte des vaches qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de quatre mois.Cette diversité d'activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.Actuellement il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter deux vaches.Son ambition est d'élargir ses activités agricoles et d'élevage.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man, who is father to four children, two of whom are at school. He is trained builder and works as a builder, but he also has a farming and animal rearing activity. He has four hectares of land on which he grows groundnut, millet and corn. Each year he buys cows which he fattens up and resells after four months. This diversity of activities allows him to provide for his family's needs. He is currently requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to buy two cows. His ambition is to expand his farming and animal rearing activities.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and the father of two children. 

Alaa has been the owner of a workshop since 2008, repairing cars and selling spare parts. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
 
He is requesting a $2,700 loan in order to renovate his shop and to make an outdoor ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to make an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Fatou  Sylla

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une fille qui pratique le commerce de produits cosmétiques.Elle tient un télécentre dans lequel elle vend ses produits mais aussi fait de la coiffure pour Dame car ayant subi 4 ans auparavant une formation en coiffure.Elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter des méches pour coiffure, des produits cosmétiques et des paquets de parfum.Ses revenus lui permettent de se prendre en charge et d'appuyer ses parents qui vivent au village.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une grande cantine pour élargir son activité.
texts.en: This borrower is a girl who sells cosmetics. She has a telecentre where she sells her products and also works as a ladies' hairdresser because she trained as a hairdresser four years ago. She is requesting a loan for 100,000 francs to buy hair extensions, cosmetics and packets of perfume. Her income allows her to provide for herself and support her parents who live in the village. Her ambition is to open a large stall so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetics and packets of perfume

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik runs a grocery shop. He has been engaged in this business for three years, and now has favorable conditions to enlarge it. 

Gagik plans to purchase more food and vegetables to cover the increasing demand. This loan will allow him to develop his business and get additional income, which means improved living conditions for his family. Gagik, his parents, and his brother live together.

loans.use: to pay for food and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 53, is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with six children. 

He has been making a living by running a retail shop for the last five years. He also sells cereals on the same premises for more income. Previously, he was practicing dairy farming. Simon hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, peas, and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, peas, and beans.

loans.name: Elivase

texts.en: Elivase is 26 years old and married with two children, aged 3 and 8. He runs a store where he sells hardware. He has been running this business for four years, and it has helped him provide for his family and increase his standard of living. The loan will be used to increase his inventory. He hopes to use the profits to make savings for his future and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy scrap for sale.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, 27, is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been making a living selling detergents for the last five years. She also does dairy farming to increase her income. 

Ann has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.
 
With 20,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy chemicals for making detergents.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for making detergents.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's group is composed of four hardworking women. Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and supplies for resale and will help Grace to generate greater profits and solve domestic problems. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children and buy a cow. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training. The ELA program has improved Grace's future prospects by helping her to learn how to manage her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food and supplies for resale

loans.name: Merie Ann

texts.en:
Merie Ann is from Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is single and is 28 years old. Merie Ann sells barbeque in her own stall for her daily needs. She's been in this business for almost two years and earns PHP 8,000.00 per month.

Merie Ann has been a member of GDMPC for almost three years. Merie Ann is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase additional barbeques for her stall. In the future, Merie Ann wants to expand her barbeque business and build more barbeque stalls.

loans.use: to purchase additional barbeques for her stall

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Fatuma has a business selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for six years and she works seven days out of every week.  Fatuma sells her products from home at retail.  Fatuma has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Fatuma include increasing prices of clothes and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and build rental rooms. Fatuma lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 200 meters of cloth at $2 per m

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and married. He has been running a carpentry business for the last three years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to increase his income. 

Joseph is requesting a loan for  50,000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to buy timber and animal feeds. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to purcase timber and animal feeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her small farm, which grows a variety of vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more seeds and tools, and will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits and pay for school fees. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Elizabeth's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and tools,

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en:
Immaculate's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Immaculate is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past six years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her fast food stand, which sells pancakes and a traditional Ugandan bread called chapate. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more baking flour, and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Immaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land and build a house for her family. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Immaculate's future prospects by helping her to learn how to read, how to save and how to budget.

loans.use: to purchase more baking flour,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Peak milk, sardines, butter, mayonnaise, cocoa, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and blessed with three children. She has been running a cafeteria for the last three years to make a living. She also does pig farming to increase her income. She has employed three people to help her to manage the business. Margaret is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a refrigerator for storing food. In the next 5 years, she wants to open another outlet of her business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator  for storing food

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene (pictured above with a dairy cow) is 35 years old and married with two children who are 11 and 9 years old and schooling. She has been in farming for 10 solid years and currently produces milk, potatoes, wheat, maize and beans for the local market.

Irene has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats. She says there is a ready market for the goat’s milk due to its high nutritional content. She adds that the income will help her educate the two children as well as improve her family's living standards.

Irene appreciates Juhudi Kilimo services but points out unreliable rainfalls and the high cost of pesticides as the challenges.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, 54, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Doroteo, a driver, and is mother to four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their every-day expenses.

Marlyn maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products of the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 5,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be use it to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Marlyn dreams to expand her business and provide a good future for her children. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells fruit and snacks. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruit for resale, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land to build on. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Scovia's future prospects by helping her learn how to run a business and learn how to write.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit for resale,

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en: Fidelis is married and blessed with five children. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. For the last six years, she has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed. Fidelis dreams of becoming more financially stable in the future. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru: Орзигул проживает в районе Яван. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Орзигул пять лет как занимается выпечкой. На сегодняшний день она у себя дома печет лепешку для торговли. Кредит берет для приобретения муки.
texts.en: Orzigul lives in the Yavan district.  She is 30 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in to-hire construction work.  Orzigul has been involved in baking for five years.  Today, she bakes flatbread at home for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes: jeans, underwear, bras, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is forty five and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is the father of five children. He has been in the computer service business for ten years. George started his computer service business with small capital obtained from manual labor. His hardship is customers not paying on time after rendering the services. George's personal goal is educating his children to university level and he hopes to expand his computer service business into new market areas. George is requesting a loan to buy computer spares and accessories for sale.

loans.use: To buy computer spares and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri is 56 years old and married with four children. Her husband is retired and all of her children are married. She has been selling items used for daily needs in her store for 10 years. This is her third loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She will use this loan to buy more rice, eggs, flour, sugar and snacks in bigger quantity to resell in her store.

Her favorite part of doing this business is serving and meeting the customers. Her store has a good potential opportunity to grow because it is located where there are only a few stores. Her future plan is to extend her store space and sell a greater variety of things. She hopes she can continue to live happily with her husband with this income.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, flour, sugar and snacks to resell in her store

loans.name: Rohani

texts.en:
Rohani is 31 years old and married with two children. They are eight and three years old. The older one, Krisna, is going to school. From Rohani's house, she sells things such as clothes, sandals and Tupperware on credit.  She has been doing this for seven years and her business is going well. By doing this business, she can help her husband to pay for her child's school fees. Now, she gets more orders for Tupperware. With this loan, she will buy more Tupperware to sell on credit. She enjoys promoting her business in her neighborhood.

Her future plan is to begin selling electronic goods on credit. The main problem with this is having enough starting capital. Over time, with her savings and another loan, maybe she can achieve this. Her hopes for her family are that they'll continue to have enough savings to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: to buy more tupperware to sell

loans.name: Hendrik

texts.en:
Hendrik is a 47-year-old man, married to Yuliana, a 39-year-old lady. They have been blessed with five children, namely:

•	Nisa, 28, and married,
•	Adi, 25, and living on a different island,
•	Lody, 23, and married,
•	Marselina, 22, and studying at a local university,
•	Leonard, 16, and studying in the second grade of senior high school.

Hendrik owns a kiosk business which has been running for years. He sells snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, etc. He initiated the business using his own capital. Hendrik operates the business for 24 hours every day, as it is located near a hospital. He intends to add a greater variety of snacks, cigarettes and soft drinks, etc., as demanded by his customers. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 Indonesian rupiah. He really hopes that TLM will assist him with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of snacks, cigarettes, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Зариф проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 33 года. Женат. У них трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он шесть лет. Кредит берет для того чтобы заменить шины и приготовится на зиму.
texts.en: Zarif lives in the Shahrinav district.  He is 33 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Zarif provides a taxi service and has been working in this field for six years.  He is requesting this loan in order to replace tires and prepare for the winter.

loans.use: to replace tires

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a man who works in the fish factory. Dinara herself works as a nurse. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 10000 soms, the family started to cultivate agricultural products for making additional money to family budget. With the profits gained from selling agricultural products the couple was able to provide their children with a good education. They also purchased household appliances and improved their living conditions. Dinara applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest. In the future she dreams to purchase a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of fish

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine is 30 years old and has 3 children aged 3 to 7, with the eldest in school. She is married to a businessman. Ernestine has been selling sorghum for 6 years. Ernestine would like a loan to buy more sorghum to sell. She hopes to use the profits to create savings for her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Abibu

texts.en: Abibu, 26 years old, lives in a rented house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in salt for five years. In his area, the salt trade is a common business located around the lake and the locals find it lucrative. Abibu's hardship is rain; when it rains, the miners have limited access to the lake for salt mining. Abibu dreams of constructing a house for his family. He is requesting this loan to buy salt for resale.

loans.use: To buy salt to resell

loans.name: Aliou Badara

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou est âgé de 55 ans, il habite dans le sud Sénégal. Il est  marié  a une femme et père de 3 enfants :les deux  les plus âgés fréquentent  l'école secondaire et le dernier est inscrit   dans  une école école primaire de la localité ou ils habitent.Il a une expérience de 15 ans dans le secteur du commerce ou il évolue.Il est spécialisé dans la vente d'habillement.Il démarre sa journée de travail a 8h30 et la termine a 21heures le soir.Il est sociétaire de l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l'achat d'articles qu'il commercialise. Son objectif est d'augmenter son fond de roulement et  d'élargir son activité commerciale. Les bénéfices que lui procurent son activité l'aident a assurer les dépenses liées a la nourriture de la famille et a la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Aliou is 55 years old, lives in the south of Senegal, is married and has three children.  Two of his children are in secondary school and one attends the local primary school.  For 15 years he has been in the trading industry, and his business advances. He specializes in selling clothing. He begins his day at 8:30 AM and ends at 9 PM. He is a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC. He is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs in order to buy clothing to sell. His objective is to increase his working capital and enlarge his trading business. The profits from his business allow him to pay for food for his family and school for his children.

loans.use: to buy fabric to build up his stock.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 30-year-old single man who is living with his mother and two sisters. James graduated from Vocational school.

James is the breadwinner of his family since the death of his father nine years ago. He is responsible for generating income for his family. Besides working in a private company, James is also running a rental room business to generate more income for his family. He has four old rooms that are constructed of palm branch walls, a zinc roof and a cement floor. The business is located 200 meters from his residence.

James is planning to renovate the rented rooms but he does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, he is seeking a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000. Through the loan, James would like to purchase building materials such as zinc, cement and sand to repair the rented rooms. James is hoping that TLM will assist him with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as zinc, cement and sand to repair his rental rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is married and blessed with one child who is still in school. For the last three years, he has been running a retail shop to make a living. He also practices dairy farming for more income. In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. Joseph is requesting  a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale

loans.name: Fabulous Virtuous Women (A) Group

texts.en:
Doreen is 33 years old and lives in Harare. She is married to a pastor; they have one child and look after three more dependents.

Doreen travels to Mozambique and Tanzania to buy clothes which she sells in the local market.  She has been doing this for two years and business is going well, but there is a lot of competition in the market. Doreen will use the loan buy more goods to sell and she hopes to continue to take further loans.  Doreen hopes that the profit will go towards making the family a little better off.  She hopes to be able to open a clothing store in the central business district if things go well.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Alafia A Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Alafia A” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small-town in Western Sierra Leone, near Freetown. “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch in this town specifically to help mothers of school-aged girls. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata.  Fatmata is age 55.  She was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is a social worker.  Two of her children are attending primary school and 3 are in secondary school. 

For more than 20 years now, Fatmata has been a businesswoman. She sells palm-oil, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), rice, etc.  With her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, gari, rice, etc, at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en: Nayef is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a construction laborer for the past 15 years. In 2000, he decided to start working independently. So, he made deals with multiple construction project's owners and individuals in order to take the responsibility of achieving all the paving work. With his requested loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase more materials needed. In the future, he plans to open his own paving factory.

loans.use: to purchase more materials needed

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 31 year-old single man.  He does a carpentry. He has been in this business for the last two years and earns an income of KES.11,900 per month.

Patrick has a good credit history in KADET LTD, and he is applying for his second loan of KES.30,000 with which he plans to buy wood for the business.  He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

Patrick hopes to raise a family and to boost the business to be big. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase wood for the business.

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en: Leonie is 27 years old and is married, with a one-year-old child. She runs a store where she sells clothes. She has been working in this business for 6 years. The business has helped her to provide food for her family. Leonie would like a loan to buy more clothes to sell in her store.  She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and create savings for her family"s future.

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jenina's Group

texts.en:
Jenina's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Jenina is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Jenina has been working hard to manage her small grocery store, which sells dry foods like maize and coffee. 

To help expand her business, Jenina has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and supplies, and will help Jenina to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Jenina hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Jenina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jenina's future prospects by helping her to learn how to take care of customers.

loans.use: to purchase more food and supplies,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize for resale

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 30-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a car repair shop since 2009. having already had 15 years of previous experience in this occupation. Mahmoud specializes in changing cars' oil and batteries. He also provides car wash services. Mahmoud is now asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase oil and batteries. He says that these purchases will help him better serve his customers. His income is needed to help support his wife and two children.

loans.use: to purchase oil and batteries

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa is a 38-year-old married woman, with four children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Kasifa has operated a retail shop for five years. Her hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, inflation and price fluctuations. Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to diversify her business. Kasifa is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Leh We Lek Wesef B Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Leh We Lek Wesef B” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mabinty, 37 years old. She was born in  Moyamba, a town in southern Sierra Leone, but she currently resides in Waterloo, together with her husband and 4 children. Mabinty's husband is an artist and her children attend primary and secondary school. Mabinty has been a businesswoman for 20 years, selling fish. With the help of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying dozens of fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of fish

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 42 years old. He is married to Margaret and they have three children aged from 3 to 15 years old. Patrick has successfully operated a barber shop in Kakamega for the last eight years. He makes a monthly income of KES 11,800 and it is through this income that he has diversified to other business such as car battery charging and video shows.

Patrick is taking a first loan of KES 20,000, which he will use to buy new shaving machines and shaving shampoos. As part of his business diversification, he will also buy a car battery charger. Patrick is ambitious since he hopes to one day open a cereal business shop to supplement his monthly income. He hopes to be a successful businessman in Kakamega.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines and shaving shampoos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 39-year-old Lebanese single man living on his own. He has been working in the agricultural field for the past 16 years.  In 1998, he bought a plot of land where he started to cultivate vegetables according to the season. With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to increase his business productivity. Therefore, his sales will increase his income. In the future, he plans to start cultivating exotic fruits.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 23 year-old business lady. She is married and a mother of three children. She runs a café, a business that has been in operation for the last seven years. 

Mariam has been a KADET client, and this marks her second loan to finance her business. She plans to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables and cereals for her business. Her dream is to own a café.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables and cereals

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a forty-five year-old married man with five children. He has been selling tea for four years, a business which he started with very little capital.  He has seen it grow over the years. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase a variety of tea ingredients. His personal goal is educating children and his business goal is to have a variety of business ventures for diversification of income avenues. James needs the loan to buy seats for his customers at the cafe.

loans.use: To buy seats for his cafe.

loans.name: Urankhuu

texts.en: Mr. Urankhuu, 20, is a miner who works a mine located far from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 2 years he has been working as a miner there. He lives with his family in an old house which is located in the slum district. His house becomes very cold and frosted during the winter because it does not have any insulation in its walls. Therefore, he decided to make the insulation and install a new electric furnace. The loan will be dedicated to purchasing some building materials to make the wall insulation and to purchasing the new furnace.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to make wall insulation and to purchase a new furnace.

loans.name: Mounira

texts.en: Mounira is a 27-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and two siblings. In 2008, she opened a clothing store in her town where she started to sell different types of clothes. Today, she is requesting a loan of $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to get the new winter clothes collection. She’s certain that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she plans to open a branch of her shop.

loans.use: to get the new winter clothes collection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to his stock of spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en: Ankhbayar is 30 years old and runs a grocery store near her home. She lives with her son and husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her store since 2008, and there are no other grocery stores near hers. Therefore, she plans to expand it and offer her permanent customers more products. She uses a minivan to bring supplies to her store, but now she needs to exchange it for a bigger van so that she can carry more supplies. The loan Ankhbayar is taking out will be used to make payments on her new minivan so that she can bring more supplies to her grocery store.

loans.use: to make payments on her new minivan, which she will use to bring supplies to her grocery store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 36 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  He does carpentry to earn a living, which he has been doing for 11 years.  He  employs three people to assist him in the business. He has increased his business stock with his previous loans.

Daniel is requesting a loan for 30, 000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to buy timber. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stocks of clothing.

loans.name: Real Friends Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Real Friends” group from Waterloo, a small-town in Western Sierra Leone, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 3,200,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Jeneba is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old is married with 3 children. Her husband is retired and 1 of her children is attending primary school and the other 2 are no longer attending schools. Jeneba has been doing business for almost 20 years now. She sells drinks, sugar, milk, butter, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, milk, butter, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year-old married man living with his wife and five children. He has 15 years of experience working as a farmer and has been running his own farm since 2001. He cultivates all types of vegetables and uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents allow him to better monitor his products' quality during the year. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the supplies he needs to install a new plastic tent in his farm. He estimates that during the coming harvest, his profits will be increased by 10%.

loans.use: to buy the supplies he needs to install a new plastic tent in his farm.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband she is bringing up a daughter and a son. The daughter studies at school and the son is still preschool age. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 30,000 soms, Nazira started to breed cattle with the help of her husband. In her opinion it is an effective way of investing money. She is applying for this loan because she needs money to purchase more farm animals for breeding, fattening and reselling. In the future Nazira plans to expand a shed to be able to keep more animals.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding, fattening and reselling.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man living alone. He has 10 years of experience working in the agriculture field. In 2006, he bought a small plot of land and started his own farming work. His job consists of cultivating different types of vegetables and selling the harvest to multiple agriculturA. markets. 

With his requested loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to install a new plastic tent onto his farm with the intention of increasing his business productivity. In the future, he plans to create the needed savings to open his own vegetable shop.

loans.use: to install a new plastic tent onto his farm.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 26 years old, married and has one child.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living, which he has been doing for nine years.  He employs two people.  He has expanded his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Eric is requesting a loan for 100,000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to buy sugar and start a wholesale business for selling rice. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in five years.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and open a wholesale business for selling rice.

loans.name: Kargbo Group

texts.en:
Memuna is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has 4 children - 2 in secondary school and 2 in primary school. Memuna sells charcoal and firewood.  She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. 

With the help of this loan, she and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Memuna will use her share of the loan (SLL 700,000) to buy bags of charcoal and piles of firewood to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and piles of firewood to add to her business.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is from the village Bashi in the Imereti Region of Georgia. He is 58 years old and lives with his wife, Mzia. Teimuraz works as a cleaner in the Imereti Airport. He earns 116 Laris (approximately 70 USD) per month. 

Along with his main job, Teimuraz also runs a family agricultural business. The family owns eight milk cows and sells on average 140 kg of cheese per month. Also, the family has a pig and sells on average 12 piglets per year. Mzia and Teimuraz also have a greenhouse. They grow greens, tomatoes and vegetables there. In the winter months, the greenhouse is used for growing greens, and during the spring and summer months, cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. During the year the family harvests and sells on average 600 kg of greens and 1,300 kg of vegetables.

With the requested loan, Teimuraz plans to purchase materials to construct a second greenhouse. It will be used for the same purpose and will significantly increase the family's income. Teimuraz and Mzia plan to use the extra income to renovate the house, especially the bathroom, as it is in bad condition. After the renovation is complete, the family will enjoy well-deserved, improved living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a second greenhouse

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба проживает в районе Шахринав. Ей 42 года. Она разведена. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже шесть лет как Насиба занимается торговлей на рынке. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Nasiba lives in the Shahrinav district.  She is 42 years old, divorced and has four children.  She has a secondary education.  Nasiba has been involved in sales at the market for six years.  She sells children's clothing.  Nasiba is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He has owned a grocery store in his town since 2006 and has one part-time employee supporting him occasionally. He sells dairy and daily products. Today, he is asking to borrow $2,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory of added merchandise needed, such as sweets, canned food, etc… In the future, he plans to sell vegetables also from his shop.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory of added merchandise needed, such as sweets, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy customer chairs for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Sulieman

texts.en:
Sulieman is a 54-year-old man. He is married with one son and one daughter. He has one source of income from driving a taxi and another from his cafe, the project he has to increase his income. Sulieman wants to improve his cafe by purchasing more tables and chairs and new serving equipment, such as cups for tea and coffee and trays. However the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for these improvements, so he needs to take out a loan of $2000 from FATEN. 

When Sulieman gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase all the tables, chairs and new serving equipment he needs to improve his cafe and the quality of service. This will increase the number of customers he serves and also his income, in order for him to be able to provide the family with better living conditions. Sulieman is photographed in his cafe.

loans.use: To improve his cafe by purchasing more tables and chairs and new serving equipment.

loans.name: Uzziah

texts.en: Uzziah is a thirty-eight-year-old married man and is a father to six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a coffee trader and has been in the coffee business for ten years now. His major hardship is inadequate capital. He says sometimes there is a lot of coffee to buy, but capital is the limiting factor. His personal goals are educating his children and buying a car. His business goal is to buy more land to grow coffee. Uzziah is requesting the loan to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Hope To God Iv Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hope To God IV” group from Waterloo, a town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These small scale businesswomen have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 600,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mabinty is the leader of this group. The 50-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 4 children – 2 in primary and secondary schools and 2 adults. Mabinty has been a businesswoman for about 30 years now. She sells cooked foo-foo (food made out of cassava roots). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy uncooked foo-foo and cooking ingredients like fish, onions, tomatoes, palm-oil, etc. in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo to sell.

loans.use: to buy uncooked foo-foo and cooking ingredients like fish, onions, tomatoes, palm-oil, etc. in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy and grocery products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en: Mohsen is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has 15 years of experience working as a cultivator. His farm produces a wide variety of vegetables which are all sold to local markets. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase seeds in order to increase his business productivity. He will also use the loan to improve his land’s condition to make his farming work easier to complete.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.name: Gulnoz

texts.ru: Гулноз жительница района Шахринав. Ей 32 года. Она разведена. У нее пятеро детей. Гулноз у себя дома занимается торговлей мужской и женской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Она берет кредит для приобретения теплых свитеров и рубашек.
texts.en: Gulnoz is a resident of the Shahrinav district.  She is 32 years old, divorced and has five children.  Gulnoz is involved in sales of men's and women's clothing at home.  She has been in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of warm sweaters and shirts.

loans.use: to buy warm sweaters and shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh bonnie fish

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar keeps livestock and cultivates land. He has been successfully managed his business during past fourteen years. To continue business growth and develop farming, Edgar needs financial investments. With the requested loan he plans to purchase forage for the livestock. This loan will help Edgar to develop farming and sustain his family in the future. Edgar lives together with his parents.

loans.use: to pay for forage (plant leaves and stems) for raising livestock

loans.name: Jibek's Group

texts.en:
Jibek is the leader of this group. She is 56 and, unfortunately, a widow. Nine years ago, with an initial investment of 1,000 KGS, Jibek started to breed livestock. She resells the livestock after fattening, earning about 3,000 KGS per month to meet her daily needs. She has raised a son who helps her in running this business.

At the moment Jibek plans to start taking orders for sewing Kyrgyz national clothing, blankets and pillows. With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase wool, fabrics and materials. In the future, Jibek plans to open a private sewing workshop. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wool, fabrics and materials

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 44 years old man. He is married with six sons and four daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He has a bicycle repair workshop which is a source of income to the family. Mohammad wants to improve his work by purchasing a new bicycle repair kit, but he does not currently have enough money so he needs to take a loan of amount $1,500 from FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase a new bicycle repair kit, enabling him to improve the quality of his work and increase his customers, this will increase his income and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family. Mohammad is a conservative man, so his son is photographed instead in the workshop.

loans.use: To purchase new bicycle repair kit to improve his work.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas, 49 years old, lives with his wife in Lebanon. He is an experienced farmer, having worked in agriculture for the past 26 years. Abbas' job consists of cultivating vegetables. He works hard in order to enhance his family’s way of living. Abbas is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase agricultural supplies. He is sure that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Dry Fish Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Dry Fish Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 600,000 SLL per member in order to invest in their businesses. This will be the second loan from SMT/Kiva lenders to benefit this group of entrepreneurs.

Fatmata is the leader of this group. She is 36 years old and married, with 3 children who attend primary school.  Fatmata sells dried fish and has been a businesswoman for many years. With the help of this loan, Fatmata will invest in her business by buying about 5 baskets full of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy about 5 baskets of fish

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik works as a engineer. Unfortunately his salary is too low to sustain the family so Gagik is also engaged in agriculture. He would like to expand his business, which requires sufficient financial means. With the requested loan Gagik plans to purchase livestock and forage. Development of farming will help Gagik to increase the business income and insure better living conditions for his family. Gagik lives together with his wife. Gagik's son has left for abroad to work, so development of farming will allow him to come back, get engaged in agriculture and stay with his family.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Рустам женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Он добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек. Более трех лет Рустам занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает овощей. Когда он начал данный бизнес он имел 20 соток земли, а теперь расширил землю до 1 гектара. Он хочет получить хороший урожай и максимизировать свою прибыль. Рустам хотел бы получит займ в размере 5500 Сомони для покупки семена и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Rustam is married and is a responsible father of three children.  He is a conscientious and hardworking person.  Rustam has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over three years.  He grows vegetables.  When he started this business, he had 20 sotkas of land and now expanded his land to 1 hectare.  He wants to gather a good harvest and maximize his profit.  Rustam wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5500 Somoni to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 31 years old. He lives in the village Ganakhleba, Adjara Region with his parents. They are 60 years old. Gela’s family earns on living through agricultural activities. They have 0.4 hectare of land, where various vegetables and fruits are grown. Harvested greengrocery is sold to local retailers. Along with the abovementioned the family has a milk cow and sells home-made cheese. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris (approximately 360 USD). 

Gela requested credit for construction of a greenhouse. He will be able to grow the vegetables not only summer and fall but also on spring and winter seasons as well. It will positively impact the income of the family. Gela plans to reinvest the increase in income in family farming activities, in order to expand it and make more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and pepper

loans.name: Damasus

texts.en: Damasus is a hardworking business man aged 35. He is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. For the last five years, he has been running a general shop to make a living. He also operates a butcher shop for more income. Damasus has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. He has employed two people in the business. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to renovate his business premise by painting and adding more shelves. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: To renovate his business premise by painting and adding more shelves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en: Khachik is a police officer. To sustain his family properly, Khachik is also engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and beehives. To increase his business income, Khachik plans to purchase more livestock and beehives. This will allow Khachik to develop farming and ensure a sustainable future for his family. Khachik lives with his wife, pensioner mother and two children.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and beehives.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. He has been running a retail shop for the last five years. He also sells cereals for more income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to buy maize and beans for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Гулнисо проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 37 лет. Разведена. У нее трое детей. Гулнисо арендует торговую точку на рынке. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. В этой области она 17 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Gulniso lives in the Shahrinav district.  She is 37 years old, divorced and has three children.  Gulniso leases a retail outlet at the market.  She sells children's clothing and has been in this field for 17 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31 year-old single mother with one child.  She supplies cakes and mandazi to the residents of Kitengela market, where her clients are both male and females. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES.6,000 per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET customer. She is applying for her first loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy flour, baking powder and cooking oil to make more cakes and mandazi.  She will use the extra profit to open another outlet at Isinya or Mlolongo.

Mary hopes to become the best cake seller at Kitengela market.  She is very focused and visionary.

loans.use: To buy flour, baking powder, cooking oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 25 year-old married woman. She has 2 children, aged 9 months to 6 years. She describes herself as quiet and fun-loving. She operates a clothes business where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open more clothes shops.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en: Nahla is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns the only source of income for the family. Nahla wants to help her husband in paying the expense of making repairs to the taxi car such as painting, changing the engine, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough. This is why she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Nahla gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband in paying the expense of repairing the taxi. This will improve the taxi conditions, and enable her husband to work extra hours and increase his income. Nahla is a conservative woman, so her husband Naji is photographed next to the taxi car instead of her.

loans.use: to pay the expense of repairing the taxi car.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 9.  To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. She has been in the business for the last four years. Through the financial support from Faulu Kenya, she has been able to build her own house. She has also increased her business stock. Loise hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a popcorn machine.

loans.use: to buy a popcorn machine.

loans.name: Felicina

texts.en:
Felicina is 46 years old, single, and blessed with two children over 18 years.  Felicina is a retail trader in the area of Githurai 45 in Nairobi, where she supplies things like plastics, polythene bags, sugar and tea. She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of KES.8,750 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES.10,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to buy plastics and polythene bags for sale.  She will use the extra profit to expand the business, since it is quite small.

Felicina hopes to build a big shop of malimali (household) items.  She is very hard working.

loans.use: To purchase plastics and polythene bags for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 57-year-old married woman. She has seven children, aged from 10 to 22 years old. She describes herself as hardworking and dedicated. She operates a grocery store, where she sells cabbages, tomatoes, and onions. She has been involved in this business for nine years and employs one staff member.
