Her business is located in a very busy residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the loan of Kes 50,000 to add to her stock of vegetables. Her goal is to expand her business to a wholesale grocery shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to add to her stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and kale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper  for her business

loans.name: Hilda's Group

texts.en:
Hilda's group is comprised of ten hard-working women. Hilda is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Hilda has been working hard to manage her small kitchen, which sells fast food. 

To help expand her business, Hilda has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more ingredients and will help Hilda generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Hilda hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Hilda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hilda's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is a 36-year-old businesswoman from Mtopanga, Mombasa. She is married and a mother of four children. She runs a tailoring business which has been in operation for the past year. 

Claris was recently introduced to KADET LTD, and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. 

She plans to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, and zippers into her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, and zippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 48 years old. He is married and a father of three children. Raphael runs a cafe on a daily basis, a business that has been in operation for the last four years. 

He was recently introduced to KADET LTD  and this marks his first loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables, and cereals. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables, and cereals

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old. He is married and a father of two children. Joseph runs a retail shop, a business that has been in operation for the past year. 

He was recently introduced to KADET LTD,  and this marks his first loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, soft drinks, and cereals. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, soft drinks, and cereals

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is 57 and married with seven children, all adults save for the last born who is still in school. She carries out her farming in her home area of Nkubu in Central Kenya, producing and selling beans, tobacco, maize, and coffee to the local market.

Josphine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats. She says the milk produced will be consumed by the family as well as sold to provide the school fees for the last born child.

She adds that Juhudi Kilimo has been of great support to farmers, but points at poor markets and animal diseases as the major challenges.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 43 years old and is married. To earn a living, she sells secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for five years. She also owns rental houses, with which she earns extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, Josephine has improved her business because she has been trained on business management. Josephine hopes to expand her business in five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Saa'di

texts.en: Saa'di is a 52-year-old man who is married and has five sons and one daughter. All of his sons are workers with decent salaries and his daughter is a university student. Saa'di has worked in agriculture for 10 years. He wants to prepare for the winter season agriculture by purchasing seedlings and necessary fertilizers, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. So he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Saa'di gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. This will enable him to prepare well for the upcoming winter season, to have a successful crop and increase his income to live in better conditions. Saa'di is photographed in his project.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers .

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Florence is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells dry food like maize. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and coffee for resale and will help Florence to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Florence's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and coffee for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and married with three children. She is a tailor and has been in the business for the past seven years. She gets a monthly income of KES35,000 from the business.

This is her second loan term from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy more materials for sewing clothes.

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her dream is to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 42 years old and is married to Salome who is a farmer. Together they have five children ages 15,13,11, ten and four. He is a farmer besides being a carpenter. He has been in the business for the past 17 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 33,100 from the business.

This is his third loan term from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to purchase another dairy cattle.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more cattle. His dream is to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is nineteen years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Bridget has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells second-hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Bridget has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of second-hand clothes from the market and will help Bridget to generate greater profits and pay medical expenses. Bridget hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Bridget is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Bridget's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Association Dental 16 Group

texts.fr: L'association" Dental 16 " est composée de cinq femmes toutes mariées.Elles exercent dan l'artisanat notamment la teinture. Elles achètent des tissus divers et font la teinture pour les revendre à leurs clients.Le chef du groupe ( qui tient la fiche d'autorisation)est une femme très dynamique qui a subi une formation de trois mois en teinture.Chaque mois, elle place ses produits à domicile et se fait payer au bout de deux mois.Elle est mère de trois enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Son activité lui permet de prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et leur habillement.Pour satisfaire la forte demande à l'approche de la fete de "Tabaski", l'association sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 250000f pour acheter du tissus et des produits de teinture.L'association ambitionne de s'implanter au marché central pour toucher le maximum de clients.
texts.en: The group “Dental 16” is made up of 5 married women.  They  all work in the business of tinting fabric.  They buy various types of fabric, dye them, and sell them to their customers.  The leader of the group (who is holding the permit) is a very dynamic woman who has had three months of training in fabric dyeing.  Each month, she takes her products home and is paid at the end of two months.  She is the mother of three children who all go to school.   Her work allows her to take care of her own needs as well as schooling and clothing for her children.   To meet the high demand at the arrival of the festival of Tabaski, the loan group is requesting from l’UIMCEC  a loan of 250000 F to buy fabric and tinting products.   The group hopes to set up shop at the central market in order to reach the maximum number of customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tinting products.

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver is 64 years old. He lives in the village of Zeniti in the Adjara Region. He lives with his family: his wife Zhuzhuna and their 18-year-old son. All family members are involved in the family agricultural business. They have a milk cow. Milk is used for cheese production. Produced cheese is sold in the local market. In addition, the family owns a tangerine garden on 0.6 hectare of land and they have 400 nut trees. Harvested tangerine and nuts are sold to local retailers and wholesalers. 

Along with agriculture, Enver works as a taxi driver. He provides transportation services to the local population. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris (approximately 485 USD). 

Enver requested a loan for the family agricultural business. In particular, he will enclose the nut garden and purchase wooden boxes to store the harvested tangerines prior to sale.

loans.use: to purchase materials for enclosing the nut garden and wooden boxes for storing tangerines

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 33 years old, married to Doreen, and a father of four children. He runs a posho (corn) mill which helps him in sustaining his family. He has been in this business for a period of a year, with a monthly profit of KES 3,000.

He has applied for a loan of KES 40,000, which he used to buy more maize for grinding into maize flour for sale.

The anticipated profit will be used to expand the business.This is his second loan with KADET LTD. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a better businessman.

loans.use: to buy more maize for grinding into maize flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Turumwe Group

texts.en: Marie is a group leader. She has two children who are 6 and 10 years old. Both of them are enrolled in school. Marie sells bananas and makes a local beer. She has been selling bananas for eight years. Her husband works as a house builder. Some group members sell different foodstuffs and others sell construction materials. Marie plans to reinvest in the business and add new products from the profits she will gain. In the future, she plans to own a booming business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Ntinkoy

texts.en:
Ntinkoy is 37 years old, married and has five children.  He practices livestock farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 11 years.  He is able to provide for his family and educate his children with the income from his business. He has improved his business through Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management.

Ntinkoy hopes to expand his business in five years. He needs a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy goats.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a farmer living in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. His produce of tea and milk go to the local market. He has been farming for the last 15 years. He lives with his family of three children between the ages of 18 and 11.

Philip has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to pay for the education of his children and to provide for other basic needs. He remains optimistic his business will double in five years. He sees lack of capital as the major challenge.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking fat and chairs

loans.name: Concepter

texts.en:
Concepter is aged 30 and has been in farming for over six years, producing and selling eggs, milk and tea to the local market in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. She is married with two children, and the first one is already attending school. 

Concepter has made a loan request of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds to boost her poultry farming business. She hopes that the additional birds will boost her farming income and build a good foundation for her children.

Concepter laments the poor markets for farming outputs.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 28 years old. She is married to Muthama. Together, they have three children, aged 6, 2 and 1 year old. She own a retail shop besides owning a posho mill (to grind corn into flour). She has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase maize to use in the posho mill and also to sell in the retail shop.

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She wants to expand her business and own another posho mill.

loans.use: to purchase maize.

loans.name: Leshoko

texts.en:
Leshoko is a 37-year-old married man with three children.  To earn a living, he practices livestock farming.  He has been in this business for twelve years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with his previous loans.  He has also become more focused in his business.
Leshoko hopes to add more livestock to his farm.  Hence he has requested for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy goats.

loans.use: buy more goats

loans.name: Mamadou Sire

texts.fr: Mamadou est  âgé de 43 ans.Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont deux fréquentent l'école du quartier ou il habite.Il évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 1986 et commercialise des produits alimentaires. c'est son fils ainé qui habituellement l'aide  a sa descente de l'école dans les activités de vente au sein de la boutique.Les bénéfices que lui génère son activité lui permettent de supporter les charges familiales. Il est sociétaire de l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l'achat de denrées alimentaires destinées a mettre en œuvre l'ouverture d'une deuxième boutique , ce qui lui permettra de servir les populations qui sont un peu éloignées de la première boutique.Son principal objectif est la satisfaction des clients. Mamadou veut devenir le plus grand commerçant du coin.
texts.en: Mamadou S., aged 43, has been a merchant since 1986.  He is married and has four children, two of whom attend school.  The oldest helps him with his business after coming home from school. With his business, he is able to meet all the needs of his family.  Mamadou S. would like to open a second shop near the first one to be able to meet the demand of the customers in his neighborhood, where there are not enough shops.  With his two shops, he would like to become an important merchant in his area because he has a large neighborhood shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell in his new store

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is aged 26 and has been in farming for six years in his hometown of Litein. His farm produces milk for the local market.

Robert has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase a chaff cutter for his dairy farm. He adds this will help with the feeding of his dairy cows and reduce the waste currently being incurred. He adds that the income will make life better for the family.

He reiterates that a lack of finances is a major limitation for farmers.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a 21-year-old young woman.  She is married and her husband is a painter who paints walls and houses, earning a decent salary. Rahma wants to purchase new washing machine and new stove to improve her living, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN.  When Rahma gets the loan, she will be able to purchase a new washing machine and stove.  This will improve her home conditions positively. 

Rahma is a conservative woman, so her husband Abdullatef is photographed instead.

loans.use: buy a new washing machine and stove.

loans.name: Association Dental 12 Group

texts.fr: L'association "Dental 12" se compose de cinq  femmes dont deux sont mariées et trois célibataires.Elles se sont associées pour renforcer leurs activités de commerce de tissus et d'articles de mercerie. Elles s'approvisionnent dans la capitale et revendent leurs produits à domicile .Cette activité constitue leur principale source de revenus.Le chef de groupe ( à droite, avec la fiche) est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont l'un est élève au college.Elle tient une cantine devant son domicile dans laquelle elle vend des tissus, des parfums , des sacs, des habits pour femmes et enfants et des chaussures.Elle parvient à obtenir des bénéfices modestes qui l'aident tant bien que mal à prendre en charge certains besoins de sa famille.L'association, pour renforcer son fonds de commerce sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.L'ambition des femmes est d'acquérir des boutiques au marché central de leur localité.
texts.en: The group “Dental 12” is made up of five women, two of whom are married and three are single.  They have joined together to strengthen their business of selling fabric and sewing supplies.  They get their supplies in the capital and sell their products from home. This work is their main source of income. The leader of the group (to the right with the paper) is married and the mother of three children, one of whom is a secondary school student.  She has a booth in front of her home from which she sells fabric, perfumes, handbags, clothing for women and children, and shoes.   She manages to make modest profits which greatly help her to take care of certain family needs.  The group, in order to increase its working capital, is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs to buy fabric and sewing articles.  The goal of these women is to set up shop at the central market where they live.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Prisilla

texts.en:
Prisilla is a mother of two children who are 11 and 7 years old. She has been in farming for 16 years with her current production of milk being sold at the local market. She retails tea sourced from other farmers in the area at the local market.

Prisilla has requested a loan of 40.000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a dairy unit for her animals. She says the good care for the animals will improve her farming income and boost the family well-being.

Prisilla says Juhudi Kilimo is providing great help to farmers but notes poor prices for the milk remain a challenge.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La cliente empezó con una atención de servicio de te en un pequeño kiosco  en la localidad de Chimoré, poco a poco fue estableciendo clientes con el servicio de té y café. Con el pasar del tiempo se aprovisiono de equipos pequeños para repostería, también recibió capacitación de las Ong´s para preparación de empanadas, salteñas, tortas, etc., así en su inquietud de poder incrementar su producción la cliente solicita un crédito que le aliviane las inversiones que se proyecte para poder atender la demanda de sus clientes que fue creciendo y que ahora es una oportunidad para poder incrementar en equipos y así pueda producir mejor y con mayor cantidad.  Con el dinero que se le otorgue se comprara un horno el cual hará mas efectiva su producción de sus productos para llegar mejor al paladar de sus clientes. En reiteradas oportunidades la cliente trato de ahorrar para comprar su horno pero la inversión en sus productos no le permitía, ahora con el apoyo del crédito la cliente contara con un horno lo que hará que su actividad crezca y se desarrolle mas.
texts.en:
The client started a tea service in a smal kiosk in Chimoré.  Little by little she was establishing customers with her tea and coffee service.  As time passed she furnished it with small pastry equipment.  She also received training from the NGOs in preparing empanadas, “saltañas” (meat filled pastries), and cakes, etc.

Due to her interest in being able to increase production, she is requesting a loan.  The loan is to improve the investments that are planned in order to be able to meet her customers’ demand.  The demand has grown, and now there is an opportunity to be able to get more equipment.  This way she will be able to have better production and produce in greater quantity.

With the money that is granted to her she will buy an oven.  The oven will make the production more effective.  The will make her products taste better for her customers.

On repeated occasions the client tried to save to buy her oven.  However, the investment in her products did not allow her to buy the oven.  Now, with help from the loan, she will have an oven, which will make her business grow and develop more.

loans.use: to buy an oven in order to prepare her products.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is from the village of Balghojiani in the Kakheti Region. He is married and lives with his wife Ketevan.  Akaki and Ketevan earn a living through a family agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf.  They also grow cabbages and watermelons. The harvested fruit and vegetables as well as the dairy products are sold in the local market. The total average monthly income for the family is 550 Laris (approximately 330 USD). 

Akaki requested credit to purchase more calves. He will raise them during winter and spring and sell them in the summer for a higher price. The family will gain profit from the sale, which will be used for house renovation. After the house is renovated, the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr:
L'emprunteur est un homme marié et père de 6 enfants dont 2 filles et 4 garçons.Quatres de ses enfants vont à l'école.Il exerce le commerce de fruits durant toute l'année.Il s'approvisionne dans les pays de la sous- région et revend ses priduits en détail, en demi- gros et en gros selon la clientèle.
Son activité lui permet de nourrir sa famille et de prendre en charge l'essentiel de leurs besoins.Actuellement, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour dans les champs du sud du pays.Son ambition est d'élargir ses capacités financières pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
This borrower is married and has 6 children: 2 girls and 4 boys.  Four of his children attend school.  His business is selling fruit throughout the year.  He stocks up in the countries in the subregion and resells his products retail, wholesale direct to the public and wholesale, according to the customer.  His business allows him to feed his family and cover their most essential needs.

The borrower is currently requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy products from the fields in the south of the country.  His ambition is to enlarge his financial capacity so that he can increase his business.

loans.use: to buy 17 tons of melon

loans.name: Elizabeth Waithira

texts.en:
Elizabeth paid her previous loan well and in good time. Her business has grown and become very stable, with a monthly profit of KES 10,000. This is her second loan, which she plans to use to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand the business. Her hopes and dreams are to own a rental shop, educate her children up to university level and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, green vegetables and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Ngetich

texts.en:
Ngetich is age 27 and married with 2 children who are 4 and 2 years old. He has been in farming for 10 years. He currently employs one farmhand and sells his produce of milk to the local market. He also operates a motorcycle transport business. 

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow for his dairy farming business. He says the additional cow will boost his dairy income and enable him to expand his transport business as well. He is optimistic the businesses will continue to grow and be able to provide for the family's basic needs.

He says lack of finances is the major challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Audax, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  He has had a welding business for nine years now.  He works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a really good monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to purchase the missing items in his workshop and for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his stock of welding equipment. His dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land.

His will share this loan with his loan group "Wito", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase welding equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre trabajador, honrado y luchador, a sus 42 años de edad se encuentra emprendiendo negocio en una ciudad nueva para él, ya que toda su vida desde su nacimiento vivió en Abejoral, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia, pero hace 1 año tomo la decisión de emprender un nuevo negocio en la ciudad de Medellín.

Wilson compro un local, allí monto una tienda donde vende gran variedad de productos, como alimentos, licores, dulces, fritos y mucho más. Actualmente solicita un crédito para poder adecuar bien el negocio, y poder surtirlo más, con la ilusión que mejoren sus ventas, su negocio tenga acogida en el mercado y con el aumento de sus ingresos pueda traerse a sus padres desde Abejorral a vivir con el a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Wilson is a hard-working, honest and tenacious man.  At 42 years of age, he is starting out in a business in a new city.  He lived his whole life, since he was born, in Abejorral, a town in Antioquia department, but one year ago he took the decision to start a new business in the city of Medellín.

Wilson bought sales premises and set up a store where he sells a wide variety of products such as food, liquor, sweet treats, fried food and a lot more besides.  He is currently requesting a loan to fit out his business and stock it some more.  He hopes to improve his sales.  His business is popular and an increase in his income would enable him to bring his parents from Abejorral to live with him in the city.

loans.use: to fit out his business premises and buy a larger quantity of stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 41 years old. He lives in the village of Ruispiri in the Kakheti Region. Gocha is married and lives with his family: two daughters (12 and 10 years old) and his parents.  The children go to school.  

Gocha’s mother trades in grocery products. His father is busy with agriculture, looking after 240 peach trees. Along with this work, the family also has a milk cow.   The harvested peach and dairy products are sold locally. The total average monthly income for the family is 1600 Laris. 

Gocha has a small vulcanization station in the village. He provides tire services to drivers in his and nearby villages. Gocha requested credit to purchase used tire-covers. He will repair them and sell them in his vulcanization station.  This will increase the income of his family, which will be used for the family's well-being.

loans.use: buy used tire-covers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, and rice for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hair weaves and clothes

loans.name: Fabulous, Virtuous Women (B) Group

texts.en:
Lonchin lives in Harare with her husband and two children.  She makes peanut butter, which she sells locally. She has been doing this for the last four years. They also have income from her husband's job as driver for a community bus.

The business faces competition but is faring well. Lonchin will use the money she has borrowed to buy raw materials and packaging.  She hopes to be able to borrow more money in the future to buy more equipment.  Over time, Lonchin wants to expand the business to help support the family.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and packaging

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Delfina, es casada; la socia tiene 54 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos,la  socia sigue teniendo su negocio de venta de comida,ella vende ceviche en una carreta en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinra como carne,pollo y verduras.
              
La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Delfina, age 54, is married and has two children.  

She still has her business of selling food.  She sells "ceviche" (typical Peruvian dish made mainly from raw fish marinated in citrus juice) from a cart in an itinerant manner.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  

She wants to expand and improve her food selling business.  She is requesting the loan to buy products for cooking.  She will buy products like meat, chicken, and vegetables.

She is very grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products like meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and tops.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
Martha lucia es una mujer casada, que en compañía de su esposo decidieron independizarse laboralmente  y emprender su propia microempresa, desde hace 5 años tienen una tienda en el barrio donde viven, en la cual venden productos en general de la canasta familiar, ella dice que les ha ido muy bien y han tenido muy buena acogida gracias en parte a la buena asesoría que han recibido de su suegro quien por mas de 50 años se dedico a esta misma labor. 

Actualmente, y con la intención de continuar creciendo, se ven en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para aumentar el surtido y la variedad de sus productos, en especial comprar granos y gaseosas, que son productos que tienen muy buena rotación en su negocio, todo con la ilusión que al paso del tiempo pueda ampliar su negocio, ofrecer mas variedad y calidad en servicio y productos a sus clientes y al tiempo que aumenta sus ventas, ingresos y proporcionalmente mejora su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Lucia is married.  She and her husband decided to become independent workers and to establish their own small business.  For five years they have had a store in the neighborhood where they live.  They sell basic needs products.  She says that it has gone very well for them, and it has been very well received.  This is partly thanks to the good advice they have gotten from her father-in-law, who did this same work for over 50 years.

With the intention of continued growth, they now see the need to request a loan.  The loan is to increase their stock and the variety of their products.  They will especially buy grains and soft drinks, which are the products that have a good turnover in their business.  This is all done with the hope that, in time, they will be able to expand their business.  They will be able to offer more variety, more products, and quality service to their customers.  When their sales and income increase their quality of life will improve proportionately.

loans.use: to buy products, especially grains and soft drinks, to stock their store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of the children is currently in school. For the past four years, Florence has been working hard to manage her salon, which provides haircuts and styling for local women. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair oil, which will help Florence generate greater profits and improve her quality of life. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more hair oil

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 27 years old and married to a farmer. She has three children who are 3 to 5 years old. The eldest child is currently in school. Jeanette sells different items such as cooking oil, sugar, maize flour, and rice in a store that she has been running for eight years. She would like this loan to increase her inventory in her store. Her business has helped her to provide for all of her family's needs. She will use the profits from her business to build a house. She is very proud about her business and hopes to see it prosper.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline has four children between 8 and 17 years old. All the children go to school. Her husband works as a technician. Jacqueline sells vegetables and she has spent years doing this. She needs this loan to buy more vegetables to expand her business. With the profits, she wants to establish a store for her sales and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria Lucy

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maria, es conviviente; la socia tiene 38 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de pananderia,ella prepara diferentes tipos de pan y luego lo vende en el distrito de Oropesa,la socia trabja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de panaderia. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mantequilla,aceite y harina paraa preparar pan.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: María has a spouse; she’s 38 years old and has three children.  She’s still a baker; she makes a variety of types of bread to then sell in Oropesa District.  She works from 8am until 7pm and is able to support her children with this business.  She wants to expand the bakery and is asking for a loan to buy butter, oil and flour to bake bread.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy butter, oil and flour to bake bread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes and day old chicks to raise

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 42 years old with two children who are in secondary school and high school. She is managing a small shop that sells fresh fruits at retail. Her business started in 2009. One year later, she got a loan from SEDA micro credit program.  Her business has developed further from that time and it creates a stable income for her to manage her family life.  During her participation in the program, she is always a good repayer. For the new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,184,000 VND.  With this amount of money, she will buy more kinds of fresh fruits to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fruit to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Francisca tiene 43 años de edad, es viuda y  tiene  cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad del Anta y vive en la comunidad de Compone y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y crianza de animales menores. Fransisca tambien se dedica a la elaboración de lácteos como por ejemplo queso y yogurt. 

En esta oportunidad Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar un más yogurt. 

Francisca agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Francisca belongs to the “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank.  Each monthly meeting takes place in the city of Izcuchaca in the community of Compone.  Francisca is 43 years old, widowed and has four children.  She was born in the city of Anta and lives in the community of Compone where she carries out her economic activities.  She sells milk and raises small farm animals.  She also makes dairy products like cheese and yoghurt, for example.  On this occasion, Francisca needs the loan to buy more yoghurt.  She values and is grateful for the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more yoghurt.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Vilma: es soltera y la socia sigue teniendo su tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productros de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,el socio trabja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Vilma is single and continues running her grocery store.  She sells basic staples like rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She works from 8am until 7pm and is able to get ahead thanks to this business.  She wants to expand the grocery store.  She’s happy for the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital so that he can buy various items (oil, rice, beans, salt, cookies, candy, shoes, toothpaste...) in bulk for re-sale to make higher profits.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is from the village of Kondoli in the Kakheti Region. This region is famous in the country for its well-developed agriculture and wine-making. 

Koba is 37 years old, married and lives with his wife Inga and 4 children: 3 daughters (15, 12 and 9 years old) and a 3-year-old son. Inga is a housewife. 
Koba is the provider of income for the family. He owns a small metal-plastic shop where he produces doors and windows. His clients are villagers living in his and nearby villages. Along with his main job, Kobs also leads the agricultural business for the family.  In particular, they have 2 milk cows and 3 calves.  Koba and Inga produce cheese and sell it at local market.  They also have 2 pigs and sell on average 20 piglets per year. The total average monthly income for the family is 500 Laris (approximately 300 USD). 

Koba requested credit to finance his new business venture. In particular, he plans to purchase grapes for wine production. Koba will sell the produced wine locally in the village.  This will give additional income to the family. They will use it to purchase household goods to improve their family’s living conditions.

loans.use: buy grapes for wine making

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Jovita no solo se dedica a la venta de granos secos sino también se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería.
En esta oportunidad Jovita requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo granos secos y una amoladora. 

Jovita se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Jovita continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Jovita not only sells dry grains but also sells hardware.  On this occasion Jovita needs the loan to buy merchandise like dry grains and a grinder.  Jovita is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and also commits to repaying her loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy dry grains and a grinder.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
a socia es la Sra. Santusa, es conviviente; la socia tiene 29 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos , la socia se segui dedicando al negocio de venta de panes,ella aluila un horno y prepara diferentes tipos de panes,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de panes.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar pan como harina,aceite y manteca al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Santusa, 29, has a spouse and three children.  She continues baking bread.  She leases an oven and makes several different types of bread.  She works from 6am until 7pm and is able to support her children through this business.  She wants to expand and improve the bread sales and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, oil and shortening at wholesale to bake bread.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 48 years old and has 3 children who attend school. She is living in Anninh village, a place busy with business activities. Hoa herself is a business women managing a shop that sells fresh fruits. Everyday, she gets 200,000 VND of profit from this activity. Her business developed more when she decided to use loans from SEDA's credit program to improve her shop in 2008 by buying more kinds of fruits from the southern province of Vietnam to sell. Currently, she requires a loan of 9,184,000 VND to buy a motorbike that will be used for fruit deliveries to outer areas.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for deliveries

loans.name: Seucheleufu Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Seucheleufu” lo conforman 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, venta de ropa usada, nueva, venta de provisiones, frutas, huevos, abarrotes, además marroquinería, preparación de productos de repostería y prestación de servicios en movilización de taxis y colectivos. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Patricia integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila y ocupa el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un polerón negro y jeans azules, su cabello además lo usa suelto. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 10 años. Comenzó como comerciante ambulante y desde hace 1 año se estableció con un local establecido de abarrotes, ubicado al interior de su casa. 
Su horario laboral es de 9ºº de la mañana, hasta las 10:30 de la noche, comenta que tiene bastante clientela, sin embargo el momento del día que más vende es durante las tardes. 
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas y distribuidoras.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio.
Las metas en su negocio son ampliar el local que actualmente tiene, para abastecerlo de mercadería y mayor variedad de productos, sus proyecciones son tener un minimarket. 
Patricia vive junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad, sus sueños a nivel personal son continuar con su negocio, ya que éste le proporciona el sustento económico que su familia necesita, además comprar un vehículo que le permita trasladar su mercadería cada vez que la compra. 
Otro de sus sueños es retomar con sus estudios en prevención de riesgos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y los servicios brindados por Fondo, comenta que existe una my buena relación junto al grupo del Banco comunal, ya que hay confianza y compromiso.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Seucheleufu” and it has 20 enterprising members who carry out a variety of occupations.  Among them are found: used clothes sales, new clothes sales, grocery sales, sales of fruit, eggs, groceries, leather working, pastry making and taxi and collective transportation service providing.  All are residents of the city of Temuco.

Patricia is a communal bank member.  In the photo she’s in the front row, first from left to right, wearing a black sweatshirt and blue jeans; she wears her hair loose.  She’s been a merchant for ten years.  She started out as a street vendor but a year ago set up a home-based grocery store.  Her work schedule is 9am to 10:30pm.  She comments that she has quite a few customers though she says that the time of highest sales is evening.  She buys her merchandise in wholesale supermarkets and from suppliers.  The loan is to buy merchandise to stock the store.  Her business goal is to expand the locale she currently has to stock it with merchandise and a greater variety of products; her projection is to have a minimarket.

Patricia lives with her two children who are 13 and 7 years of age.  Her dream on a personal level is to stay in business since this is her means of family support; she’d also like to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise each time she buys it.  Another of her dreams is to restart her risk prevention studies.  She’s very happy and grateful for the loan and the services provided by Fondo.  She comments that there is a very good relationship in the communal bank because there is trust and commitment.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Capital of Chile).  There is a series of lakeside resorts around it (Pucón, Villarrica) and very showy flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s worth mentioning that 50% of the Mapuche indigenous population that exists in our country lives in this region.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo es un hombre trabajador de 43 años. Él convive desde hace 20 años con Antonia, ambos tienen 5 hijos y todos viven en una casita humilde pero propia. Mateo, desde niño se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que le ha dado en todo este tiempo, el sustento necesario para mantener a su familia. Sus hijos ya tienen las fuerzas necesA. para ayudarlo en las labores del campo, por ello, la familia entera incluyendo a Antonia, trabaja arduamente en el campo. Siembra principalmente arvejas, siendo el producto que más ingresos le genera, además de papa, habas y maíz.  La principal dificultad que éste incansable padre de familia encuentra en todo este tiempo de vida, es la falta de capital para ampliar sus sembríos y hacerlos producir en mayor cantidad, situación que ha venido manejando gracias a la labor coordinada de su banco comunal. Mas adelante, él quisiera ver a sus hijos estudiar carreras técnicas o universitA. en la ciudad, por lo que continúa labrando la tierra para ahorrar y lograr sus metas. Con ésta serán 8 veces que Mateo trabaja con MFP y su Banco Comunal, de los que siente gran cariño por estar siempre pendientes de sus necesidades, por esa razón, él necesita de su ayuda para proseguir su camino rumbo a la autosuperación. Con el dinero, el podrá contratar personal para que apoyen en la siembra y cosecha de sus papas, que haciendo cálculos no pasarán de 5 peones en 5 días. Así el gastará 28 soles diarios por cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Mateo, 43, is a hardworking man.  He’s lived with Antonia for the last 20 years and they have five children.  They all live in a little house that’s humble but theirs.  Since childhood Mateo has been farming, an activity that has provided sustenance to support his family all this time.  His children are strong enough now to help him with the field work so the entire family, including Antonia, works hard in the fields.  

His main crop is peas since that’s what earns the most income but he also grows potatoes, lima beans and corn.  The main difficulty this tireless father faces throughout his life is the lack of capital to expand his crops and produce in larger quantities, a situation he’s been managing thanks to the coordinated work with his communal bank.  Later on he’d like to see his children study technical or university careers in the city so he continues working the land to save up and reach his goals.

This will be the 8th time Mateo works with MFP and his communal bank for which he feels much affection because they are always concerned for his needs.  Because of this, he needs their help to continue along his road to self-improvement.  With the money, he’ll be able to hire personnel to help him with potato planting and harvesting which he calculates will not be more than five day workers for five days which will mean a daily expense of 28 soles per worker.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Alcira Enoe

texts.es: Alcira Enoc tiene 47 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Desde hace mas de 21 años el se dedica a esta actividad, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Uno de sus problemas es que su papa se encuentra enfermo y ella tiene que estar pendiente de él para cuidarlo. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, jabón, fósforos, papel higiénico y sopas. Ella siempre se encuentra feliz de proporcionarle a su clientes lo que le solicitan.
texts.en: Alcira Enoe, 47, has a grocery store.  She’s been in this line of work for over 21 years.  She has two children in her care.  One of her problems is that her father is ill and she has to care for him.  The reason for the loan is to buy snacks, soft-drinks, bread, basic grains, soap, matches, toilet paper and soup.  She’s always happy to provide her customers with what they ask her for.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Tanaka Group

texts.en:
Sibongile is a 27-year-old married mother from Masvingo, Zimbabwe living with her two children, ages 3 and 4 years. The children do not yet attend school, but are under early learning stages. 

Sibongile has been in the business of buying and selling kitchenware and clothes. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. The major challenge faced is of finances, which she said if granted the loan of 300 USD, she will be able to buy more wares and different type of clothes for resale. This loan will make their life easy in getting some basic food, as well as paying for her children's fees (early learning fees). 

In the future, Sibongile is planing to have a bigger shop in Masvingo Town.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and clothes for resale

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
Norberta sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Norberta no solo se dedica a la venta de leche sino también se dedica a la venta granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, gallinas, pollos y ovejas. 

En esta oportunidad Norberta requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo pollos y gallinas.   

Norberta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Norberta continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Norberta not only sells milk but also sells basic grains like corn and barley.  She also raises small farm animals like pigs, hens, chicks and sheep.  On this occasion Norberta needs the loan to buy small farm animals like hens and chicks, for example.  Norberta is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and also commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals like hens and chicks, for example.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 26 años, a pesar de no tener trabajo estable, decidió emprender su negocio que es una joyería, uno de sus problemas es que su esposo quien se encarga de ayudarle en el negocio pero tiene problemas en la columna y algunas veces no le puede ayudar en su negocio. Ella tiene 1 hijo de 7 años a su cargo ella se encarga de proporcionarle lo necesario. Este será su segundo crédito con el que comprara plata, oro, perlas, herramientas entre otros.
texts.en: María Elena, 26, despite not having a stable job decided to start her own business: a jewelry store.  One of the problems is that her husband is the person who helps her in the business but he has problems with his spine and sometimes is unable to do so.  She has a 7-year-old son in her care and she takes care of providing everything necessary for him.    This will be her second loan and she’ll use it to buy silver, gold, pearls and tools, among others.

loans.use: to buy silver, gold, pearls and tools, among others.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan is 33 years old with 3 children, two of them are at secondary school. Ms Xuan has had a shop that sells fresh fruits wholesale in a local market for 3 years. 

In 2008 she received her first loan and invested in buying fruits from a wholesale seller. Year by year, with her savings and bigger loan amounts borrowed from SEDA, she became a wholesale supplier for a smaller merchant. During her participating in the micro credit program, she has used loans effectively and also repaid very well. She hopes to borrow 9,814,000 VND in this new loan cycle.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luz Marina sigue con el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad ósea sigue con la pequeña  tienda de abarrotes. Luz María con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y es por eso desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Luz Marina requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más.   

Luz Marina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Luz Marina still sells basic staples in her small grocery store.  Luz María did very well with the previous loan and this is why she wants another one because it helps her very much with her business.

On this occasion Luz Marina needs the loan to buy basic staples like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and other things.  Luz Marina is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase more food products such as bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Duo Solidario Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Carmen Lucrecia,D. 46 años D. edad y tiene un hijo,ella se dedica a la venta D. refacciones desD. hace 13 años ella es la lider D. este duo y nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le ha hido bien en su negocio,y por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materiales para elavorar refacciones,al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica a la misma actividad el sueño D. ellas es darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que tengan mejores oportunidades D. superarse.
texts.en:
Carmen Lucrecia is 46 years old and has one child. Her business is selling snacks, which she's done for 13 years. 

Carmen is the leader of this two-person team, and they tell us that, thanks to God, their business has done well. For this reason Carmen is asking for a loan in order to buy goods to make snacks; Maria Ofelia, the second woman in the group, is also in the same business. 

Their dream is to give the best to their children and for them to have better opportunities to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy materials to make snacks.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 44 años de edad, se divorcio del padre de sus 7 hijos hace 4 años. Ella vive en la casa de su hermana con 3 de sus hijos, ya que 2 de ellos están estudiando en Lima, y los restantes trabajan en Chile. Norma es una mujer que sabe hacer de todo, empezó tejiendo y haciendo manualidades, después abrió una pequeña tienda, la que está descuidada y casi vacía. Además de eso, por las tardes vende “salchipapas” (papas y salchichas fritas) fuera de la casa. Es consciente que el dinero no le alcanza, así que también trabaja en una villa, donde cocina para deportistas, de esa manera recibe un sueldo mensual. Por otra parte, por las experiencias de amigos y vecinos, sabe que la venta de verduras es rentable. Piensa comprar arvejas, ollucos, y papas al por mayor y venderlos en la ciudad de Lima. El principal problema que ha tenido en todos estos años de lucha incansable ha sido la falta de capital para surtir su tienda. Más adelante, por recomendación de una prima, ella piensa viajar a España, allí trabajará y enviará dinero a sus hijos, para ello juntará el dinero necesario. Sería la primera vez que Norma accedería a un crédito de MFP, por tal razón se encuentra emocionada, ya que sus planes están calculados y necesita materializarlos. Necesita de su ayuda. Norma invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de arvejas, ollucos y papa. Además en el servicio de flete para trasladarlos hacia Lima. Así empezará un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Norma, 44, divorced the father of her 7 children four years ago.  She lives in her sister’s house with three of her children since two of them are studying in Lima and the rest of them work in Chile.

Norma is a woman who knows how to do a little bit of everything.  She started out weaving and making crafts.  Later she opened a small store which is currently pretty neglected and almost empty.  In addition to this, during the evenings she sells “salchipapas” (fried potatoes with fried sausages) outside her house.  She is aware that her money does not stretch far enough so she also works in a villa cooking for athletes and earning a monthly salary.  On the other hand, thanks to experiences of her friends and neighbors she knows that selling vegetables is profitable.  She plans to buy peas, olluco [a tuber] and potatoes at wholesale to sell in the city of Lima.  The main problem she’s faced throughout these years of non-stop struggle is the lack of capital to stock her store.  Later on, following a recommendation from a cousin, she plans to travel to Spain to work there and send back money to her children; she will save up the necessary money for this.

This will be the first time that Norma accesses an MFP loan so she is excited since her plans are defined and she wants to make them a reality.  She needs your help.  Norma will use the money to buy sacks of peas, ollucos and potatoes as well as pay to transport them to Lima and thus start a new business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of peas, olluco and potatoes.

loans.name: Humberto De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 47 años de edad, Humberto es un hombre trabajador y luchador que desde hace 5 años decidió iniciar su labor como ventero ambulante de comidas rápidas, actividad que viene de herencia familiar ya que su padre toda la vida se dedico a esta actividad. 

Humberto dice estar muy feliz con su negocio, ya que el puede manejar su tiempo, en semana trabaja de 10am a 6pm, y los fines de semana según el trabajo extiende su jornada laboral hasta las 10pm. Humberto esta requiriendo de un préstamo ya que necesita hacer unas mejoras en su puesto de comidas, porque a causa de las lluvias en Colombia ha tenido que cerrar mas temprano, por eso desea comprar un nuevo carro de comidas rápidas en acero inoxidable equipado con una carpa tapa sol, que le garantice su trabajo al sol y a la lluvia sin problemas, adicional al carro, también necesita comprar una pipeta de gas y comprar materia prima. Estas mejoras le permitirán crecer, aumentar sus ventas, sus ingresos, generar un empleo por el momento, pero con la ilusión de que gracias a su constante crecimiento de su microempresa, en unos años pueda ayudar a muchas personas que estén en situación de vulnerabilidad con empleos que les permitan sacar adelante sus familias.
texts.en:
At the age of 47, Humberto is a hardworking, tenacious man who decided to start working as a street vendor of fast food five years ago, an activity that’s come down as a family inheritance since his father spent his entire life in this line of work.

Humberto says that he’s very happy with his business because he can manage his own time.  He works during the week from 10am until 6pm and on weekends he extends his workday until 10pm depending on work load.

Humberto needs a loan because he needs to make some improvements to his food stand because due to the rain in Colombia he’s had to close earlier.  Because of this he wants to buy a new, stainless steel fast food cart equipped with a tent to guarantee that he can continue working both in the sunshine and in the rain problem free.  Besides the cart, he also needs to buy a gas cylinder and to buy raw materials.

These improvements will make it possible for him to grow, increase sales and income, and generate one job for the moment but with the hope that the continued growth of his micro business will lead in a few years to being able to help many more people who find themselves in a vulnerable position with respect to employment that will allow them to support their families.

loans.use: to buy a stainless steel fast food cart, a tent, a gas cylinder and raw materials.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is a business man in maize farming. He is single, and has been doing this business for more than five years.  He is requesting the loan to support labor costs and for adding more fertilizers to get more maize out-put.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.


 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs and buy more fertilizers for his maize farm.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Microfinanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Octavia sigue con el negocio de venta de maíz y sigue brindando servicio de transporte. Octavia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el capital del negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Octavia requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz y para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 

Octavia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Octavia continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Octavia still sells corn and provides transportation services.  Octavia did very well with the previous loan and this is why she wants another one because it helps her very much with her business’ capital.

On this occasion Octavia needs the loan to buy corn and to service the car.  Octavia is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn and to service the car.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 24 years old with 2 small children.  After accessing loans from SEDA credit program in 2008, she invested in developing a small mechanical work shop. However, in her free time, she went to market to buy some fruit to sell. This helped her have extra money to spend for daily expenditures. Since 2009 she decided to invest strongly in this kind of business. For her latest loan cycle she received a loan of 8,288,000 VND. She bought a variety of fruits and earned big revenue. 

Currently, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to invest in selling fresh fruits.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits to sell

loans.name: Lenuel

texts.es: Lenuel es cliente de fundación desde hace mucho tiempo, él se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Es un hombre muy trabajador y se siente contento de que su edad todavía pueda trabajar en este caso Lenuel solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, ropa para niños, faldas entre otros. Uno de sus sueños es mejorar cada día los ingresos de su familia. Lenuel tiene cinco hijos pero ninguno depende de él.
texts.en: Lenuel is a long-standing client of Fundación Leon.  His business is selling general merchandise.  He is a very hard-working man and feels happy that he is still able to work at his age. On this occasion, Lenuel is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, children's clothes, etc.  One of his dreams is to gradually improve his family's income.  Lenuel has five children but none of them are dependent.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Yanet sigue con el negocio de venta de maíz y sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores coomo por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos y chanchos. Yanet con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el capital del negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz y para comprar animales como cuyes y chanchos. 

Yanet se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yanet continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Yanet still sells corn and raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, hens, chicks and pigs.  Yanet did very well with the previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits and this is why she wants another one because it helps her very much with her business’ capital.

On this occasion Yanet needs the loan to buy corn and to buy animals like pigs and guinea pigs.  Yanet is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn and to buy animals like guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Claudia Nelly

texts.es: Claudia Nelly se encuentra muy contenta porque es la primera vez que realizara un crédito con Fundación, se siente orgullosa de tener un medio de vida como es una pulpería. A pesar de enfrentar problemas ella ha sabido sobrellevarlos el arduo trabajo y dedicación que realiza en su negocio le ha demostrado que día a día vale la pena brindar el mejor servicio. El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, detergentes, crema, refrescos, granos básicos y fósforos.
texts.en: Claudia Nelly is very pleased because this is the first time she will take a loan with the Foundation. She is proud to have a small grocery store as a way of earning her living. Though she has had to confront problems, she has been able to overcome them. The hard work and dedication that she puts into her business has shown her that day to day it is worth it to provide the best service. The loan is for the purchase of sweets, detergents, cream, soft drinks, basic grains, and matches.

loans.use: to buy sweets, detergents, cream, soft drinks, basic grains, and matches

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro D. Compone” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. Andrea sigue con el negocio D. venta D. leche y sigue dedicándose a la agricultura. Andrea con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el capital del negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Andrea requiere el préstamo para comprar vacas lecheras. 

Andrea se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Andrea continues participating in the San Isidro D. Compone communal bank, part of Unidad Microfinanza Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She continues with her business selling milk and working in agriculture.  The first loan went very well for Andrea and she managed to make good profits and for this reason she wants another loan since it helps her so much with her business capital.

This time Andrea needs the loan to buy dairy cows.

Andrea is grateful for the opportunity offered via this loan and for this reason she is committed to making the repayments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent requested a Kiva loan to support labor costs during maize production. He also needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production.
 
He wants to use the profits from his farming to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Duo El Manzanillo Group

texts.es: Duo el Manzanillo.Este grupo esta integrado por don Lorenzo de 53 años de edad,siendo el, el lider de este duo,se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 6 años, nos cuenta que desde ese tiempo a cresido en su negocio Considerablemente ya que sus animales abundan,y por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales y agrandar mas su negocio,tambien doña Maria se dedica a la misma actividad y es por eso que esta solicitando este credito.el sueño de ellos es tener un negocio de ventas de animales mas grande.
texts.en:
One member of Duo El Manzanillo is Lorenzo, 53, the leader of the pair, who has been raising animals for 6 years. He tells us that during this time his business has grown considerably. He has a lot of animals now and is requesting a loan to buy animals and increase his business even more.

Maria does the same work and is asking for a loan for the same reason. Their dream is to have a bigger animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to raise and sell animals.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán es un hombre de 71 años, que a pesar de su edad ha logrado muchas cosas en su vida una de ellas es tener su negocio que es una pulpería y ademas la venta de mercaderia en general, además tiene 15 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad. El inicio esta actividad con su esposa quien le ayudaba a realizar las tareas del hogar y además atender el negocio lamentablemente su esposa falleció, pero él siguió adelante con la actividad es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, camisolas, vestidos y trajes .
texts.en: Hernán is a 71 year-old man who, in spite of his age, has achieved many things in life. One of them is to have his business, which is a small grocery store where he also sells general merchandise. He also has 15 children, all of whom are grown-ups. He began this business with his wife, who helped him take care of the household tasks also tend to the business. Sadly, his wife passed away; however, he continued with the business. He is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, camisoles, dresses, and suits.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, camisoles, dresses and suits

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma es una mujer arriesgada y luchadora, a sus 44 años de edad está casada con César y tiene 4 hijos, de ellos 2 ya tienen familia y viven en la ciudad de Huánuco. Norma cuenta con una casa propia. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, tales como chanchos, vacas, cuyes. Menciona que, compra un chancho pequeño a 100 soles, ella lo engorda y lo cuida 4 meses, pasado ese tiempo Norma lo lleva a las ferias y los vende a 400 soles, cuadruplicando su precio. “Me conviene vender chanchitos, por que siempre se gana, y yo crío de 4 a 5 chanchitos para la venta”, explica. Aparte de ello, también siembra en unas parcelas pequeñas de terrenos  papas, arvejas y habas, cuyos ingresos son para cubrir sus necesidades diarias. Antes de consolidarse en su negocio de ganados, Norma cuenta que las enfermedades mataron a sus vacas, problema que solucionó con veterinarios, pero que al fin y al cabo significaron pérdidas cuantiosas. “Unos años después, si Dios quiere me iré a Huánuco con mis hijos y ahí construiremos una casa nueva”, dice esperanzada. Éste será su préstamo número 8 de MFP, por esa razón ella necesita de su ayuda, para alcanzar sus proyectos, ya que la falta de capital es uno de sus principales inconvenientes.  “Me siento cómoda con mi banco comunal, siempre me ha sacado de apuros”, finaliza. Norma invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos que cuesta 120 soles la bolsa, de las que necesitará 5; además adquirirá semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Norma is a daring and energetic woman. She is 44 years of age and married to Césary. She has 4 children. Two of these already have their own families and live in the city of Huánuco. Norma has her own house.

Norma is engaged in the purchase and sale of livestock such as pigs, cows, and guinea pigs. She states that she buys a small pig for 100 soles. She fattens and cares for it for 4 months. After this period, Norma takes it to the market and sells it for 400 soles, quadruple the price she paid. “It’s convenient for me to raise pigs because I always make money from them, and I raise 4 to 5 pigs at a time for sale,” she explains.

In addition to this, she also plants a few small parcels of land with potatoes, peas, and beans. The income from this covers her daily necessities.

Norma states that before her livestock business was on a solid footing illness killed her cattle. The problem was solved by veterinarians, but at the end the loss was considerable.

“In a few years, God willing, I will go to Huánuco and we will build a new house there,” she says hopefully.

This will be her eighth loan with MFP. She needs its help in order to achieve her goals since lack of capital is one of her principal hurdles. “I feel comfortable with my communal bank, she says, “It has always given me a helping hand.” Norma will invest the loan money in the purchase of 5 bags of fertilizer, which costs 120 soles a bag. She will also acquire seeds for green peas.

loans.use: to purchase pea seeds and 5 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: Danelia Justina

texts.es: Danelia Justina tiene 60 años, su actividad es una librería, desde hace más de 5 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella inicia todas las mañanas con gran alegría su trabajo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, la mayoría de sus clientes saben muy bien este negocio.
